loans.name: Odai

texts.en:
Odai is a 27-year-old young man who lives with his family in Beit Sahour city near Bethlehem in Palestine. His sister is employed by an insurance company. 
Odai owns an olive wood workshop where he produces wooden crafts such as crosses, rosaries, statues, etc. He wants to buy a large amount of olive wood in order to double production and increase his return during the Christmas season. However, the amount of money Odai has isn't sufficient so he wants to take a loan of $3,000 from Kiva partner, FATEN. When Odai takes his FATEN loan, which is to be repaid on a monthly basis, he will be ready to offer wooden crafts for sale in the Christmas season. This will increase his income and improve his life. 
Odai is photographed making one of his wooden crafts.

loans.use: to buy a large amount of olive wood in order to double production for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fodder for the sheep she is raising.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 23-year-old young woman who is married and has one son and one daughter. Her husband is a worker with a modest salary. 
Amal has a project raising sheep and selling their products, which is another source of income for her family. She wants to purchase more sheep to raise and benefit from selling their products, but the amount of money she has isn't enough. Therefore, she wants to take a loan of 500 JOD from Kiva partner, FATEN. When Amal gets the loan, which is to be repaid on a monthly basis, she will expand her project and buy more sheep. She will benefit from their products and will be able to increase her income, which will improve her family life positively and bring about better living conditions. 
Amal is photographed in a FATEN branch.

loans.use: to purchase more sheep to raise.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a 39-year-old man who is married and has five sons. He is employed in a hotel and earns a modest salary. 
Khalil has a new project raising laying hens and selling their products to increase his income. As his project is new, he wants to make some repairs to the coop and purchase more laying hens and fodder to feed them, but he hasn't enough money. Therefore, he wants to take a loan of $2,000 from Kiva partner, FATEN. When he gets the loan, which is to be repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to start his project by making repairs to the coop and purchasing laying hens and fodder. He will benefit by selling their products and thereby increasing his income. This will improve his family's living conditions. 
Khalil is shown in the photograph.

loans.use: to purchase laying hens and fodder, and repair the coop.

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Sun, 54 years old, is married and has six children. 

She has been a mixed farmer and especially a rice farmer for many years. A registered client introduced her to HKL in her abode. This is her first loan, which she plans to use to purchase farm inputs such as, fertilizers, seeds and chemicals. 

Her dreams are to become a famous farmer in the area and to educate her children to higher levels. She is an industrious woman who will struggle to achieve if funded.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and chemicals.

loans.name: Sumber Tanjung Group

texts.en:
Sumber Tanjung Group is located in a beachside community in North Bali. All the husbands of the members of the group work as fishermen. The Balinese women support their husbands' income by raising pigs at home.
After successfully paying off their first loans, the group members have proceeded to the next loan cycle with the purpose of improving their businesses. Ni Ketut, head of the group, coordinates the group members in purchasing piglets so that all group members get good ones. With this loan, she bought three local species of piglet, which are sold every two months for pork roll. From the results of this effort, Ni Ketut hopes to buy floors for her home, which are still cement. 
In the picture, Ni Ketut is wearing a pink shirt and holding her son.

loans.use: to buy three piglets of local species.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farming materials.

loans.name: Enkhtsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Enkhtsetseg, 46, runs a grocery store selling basic food commodities. She lives with her three children and husband in her own house located in Choibalsan, a town in Dornod province. Her two daughters study at secondary school and the other is a college student. Her husband, Enkhbat, works as a watchman. 
Enkhtsetseg is a very hard worker. Initially, her business started as a food kiosk in 2001. She then expanded it into a small grocery store in 2006. Now she has a plan to expand or renovate her store into a shop that sells a larger variety of food. This will be very beneficial to her family income and a good way to improve her business. Therefore she is requesting a loan to purchase building materials to rebuild her store.

loans.use: to purchase some building materials to rebuild her store.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.en:
The primary source of income from the barrio comes from raising crops. They usually plant and harvest rice and corn to generate income. 

Being a local farmer, Faustino is devoted full time to his rice farming business. He usually earns a yield twice a year, during the months of May and November. Profits earned amount to P20,000 and is just enough to cover his family's expenses such as electric bill, meals and allowances of children.

He has insufficient capital to sustain his rice field so Faustino is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy fertilizers and herbicides used in farming. With the help of this loan, he will improve his crop production and thus generate more income.

In the future, Faustino would like to achieve abundant harvests in order to save for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides for his rice farm

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is 40 years old, married and has three children to sustain. To generate income, he devotes his full time to his farming business. He plants and harvests rice and sells it to traders in the village. He usually earns about P20,000. 

He needs to improve his crop production in order to earn consistent profits for the college education of his children. He is now asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy fertilizers and pay for laborers who helped in transplanting rice seedlings in his half-hectare plot of land. With the help of this loan he would improve his yield. 

In the future, Solomon wants to see all his children well educated and owning a degree, and to have a good employment someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for laborers who help transplant rice seedlings

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph had been planting rice in his half hectare plot of land for almost 10 years. He goes down to the field everyday to ensure good crop production. Last harvest season of May, Joseph earned a yield amounting P20,000. He used it to pay tuition fees and allowances for his three children attending their secondary education.

Joseph is now asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy fertilizers, pesticides and insecticides used in farming. 

In the future, he wants to earn consistent profits to continuously send his children to their college education, to have their own degree and good employment someday. He also wants to make his family more economically stable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and insecticides used in farming.

loans.name: Ichinsuren

texts.en:
Mrs. Ichinsuren, 46, is a widow and lives with her 6 children in the slum district of Choibalsan, a town of Dornod province. She runs a stall with the vegetables that she grown with one of her daughters, in the food bazaar. Ichinsuren reared her children well and they all try to support their mother by doing what they can do individually. 

Now she has plan to expand her business accordingly, by purchasing the other stall close the her current one. It is a good way to raise her earnings as she can sell more vegetables. Also it will be an important step to improving her living condition. Therefore she is requesting a loan to cover the new stall cost.

loans.use: To purchase an additional stall and expand her vegetable sales.

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas is 36 years old. She lives with her family in Prey Chor District, Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is married and has three children. 

Currently, she is actively involved in the family agricultural business, but she has encountered financial shortages in meeting their family expenses and business needs.

To solve this problem, his husband would like to purchase one more horse for transporting goods, but he lacks capital, so he has asked her to apply for a loan through HKL, a Kiva partner. 

She believes that this loan will benefit her family and bring them happiness. 

She hopes in the future to educate her children to a high level and to have a bigger house. She is very thankful to all the kind lenders that always help her family.

loans.use: to purchase a horse for transporting goods.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 43 years old and married. She has two children.

Marites works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store.

Marites has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from vegetable farming and raising livestock.

Marites aspires to save enough money so she can expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 63 years old and married with one child. 

Teresita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Teresita has been raising pigs for 15 years now and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Teresita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 54 years old and married. She has four children, three of them have their own family and live on their own while the youngest still attends college. 

Evangeline manages her small sari-sari (variety) store in one of the windows in her house. She wants to sell more items in her store but she has insufficient funds to buy soft drinks, canned goods, milk, sugar and coffee. She is now asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy these items that would increase her sales.  

In the future, Evangeline wants to establish a more convenient store outside her house to orderly stock her groceries for her customers. Evangeline wants to continuously generate more income to achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, milk, sugar and coffee to sell in her store.

loans.name: Genna

texts.en:
Genna is married with three children. She is 46 years old and lives in Pangi, Siquijor.
Genna sells longanisa to earn a living and has run this business for two years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase longanisa meat.
Genna has been a member of Kiva partner, Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative, for five months. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and make it more productive.

loans.use: to purchase longanisa meat.

loans.name: Hanezel

texts.en:
Hanezel is married with two children. She is 29 years old and lives in Fatima, Liloy, Zamboanga Del Norte.
Hanezel runs a grocery store to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns 11,000 PHP from her grocery store business and her other business. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase grocery stock.
Hanezel has been a member of Kiva partner, PMPC, since 2011. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase grocery stock.

loans.name: Vergilio

texts.en:
Vergilio is a 25-year-old married man living in the village of Bugallon Proper Ramon. He earns a living by running a general store, which he has had for one year. From this business alone, he is able to generate an income of 20,000 PHP per month, which he uses to meet his family's daily needs.
Vergilio would like to take a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy a greater variety and greater quantity of basic goods such as assorted biscuits, canned goods, cooking ingredients, soft drinks, instant noodles, oils, eggs, milk, sugar and candies for his general store. He is hoping that this will enable him to meet the needs of his customers and attract additional customers to his store. With the requested loan he hopes to be able to generate a bigger income, save some and improve his family's living conditions. Vergilio will be glad if his loan request is granted.

loans.use: to buy groceries for his general store.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is married with six children. She is 54 years old and lives in Ubay, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.
Delia runs a sari-sari store to earn a living. This is a new business. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase groceries to sell.
Delia has been a member of Kiva partner, PMPC, since 2011. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries for resale.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is married with two children. She is 40 years old and lives in Maikay, Tudela, Misamis Occidental.
To earn a living, Annie has a beauty products retail business. She has run this business for three years. Each month, she earns approximately 5,000 PHP. Annie has been a member of Kiva partner, PMPC, for three years. She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase beauty products such as face creams, lotions and soap.
In the future, Annie hopes to send her children to school and see them complete their college degrees.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products such as face creams, lotion and soap.

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en:
Otgonbayar is 31 years old and lives with his wife and son in a ger in Uvs province, Mongolia. His wife is currently unemployed. His family wants to improve their living conditions and increase their income. 
Otgonbayar works at a construction site during the summer. He is going to start a new business that he can do at other times of the year. He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a car for his new taxi service. He has the full capacity and potential to run this business during the winter, fall and spring. He is a diligent and hardworking man who says, "I want to do this business very much."

loans.use: to purchase a car.

loans.name: Alexa

texts.en:
Alexa is 63 years old and lives in Bitibut, Sapang Dalaga. She is single and has no children. 
To earn a living, Alexa has a business selling bananas. She earns about 3,600 PHP each month doing this type of work. Alexa has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase 200 kilos of bananas to sell.
Alexa has been a member of Kiva partner, PMPC, for seven years.

loans.use: to purchase 200 kilos of bananas.

loans.name: Trang's Group

texts.en:
Trang was born in 1986. She lives in Xom Cho village, Co Loa commune. She is married with one child who is still small. Her husband is a worker with an income. 
Mrs Trang has a restaurant where she sells rice and noodles. Every day she has to get up early and go to the market to buy goods for her restaurant. She has run her restaurant for three years and makes a monthly income of about 4,500,000 Vietnamdong (VND). Since 2007 she has participated in Kiva partner, SEDA. For her last loan she borrowed 6,758,000 VND and repaid it punctually. For this loan, she would like to borrow 8,066,000 VND to buy more rice and noodles for her restaurant. 
Trang is the leader of a five-member SEDA group. The other borrowers in the group are:
Dung is 26 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 7,194,000 VND to buy food for pigs.
Hien is 36 years old. She wants to borrow 7,194,000 VND to invest in her store.
Vinh is 55 years old. She wants to borrow 5,886,000 VND to buy pork to resell.
H. is 43 years old. She wants to borrow 7,630,000 VND to buy food for poultry.

loans.use: to buy more rice and noodles for her restaurant.

loans.name: Iqbal's Group

texts.en:
Iqbal is a housewife who stays at her home and performs her household responsibilities. She is a very caring lady and is bringing up her four children very well. All of her children are enrolled in a local school and getting an education.
Iqbal has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for the betterment of her brother‘s butcher shop business. With this loan, he will buy goats to provide better quality and larger quantities of meat to his customers. Iqbal knows that her brother is very skillful in his business and has the capacity to take his business to beyond its current level. She is sure that, after the loan investment, he will be able to improve the financial condition of his business.

loans.use: to buy goats for her brother's butcher shop business.

loans.name: Dushan

texts.ru: Душан житель района А. Джоми. Ему 48 лет. Он женат. Его жена домохозяйка. У него пятеро детей. Душан имеет среднее образование. У себя дома он занимается животноводством. Разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа телят.
texts.en: Dushan is a resident of the A. Jomi region. He is 48 years old. He is married. His wife is a homemaker. They have five children. Dushan has secondary education. He does animal husbandry from his home. He breeds large horned cattle for future resale. He is asking for a loan to buy calves.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 61 years old and married. She had four children; one of them is working and sometimes helps her with other expenses. She patiently sells rice to the people in her neighborhood. In a sack of rice, she usually gains a profit of 500 Philippines pesos (P). 

Evangeline is now asking for a loan of P8,000 to buy more sacks of rice to sell for additional profits.

In the future, Evangeline wants to establish a stall so that she will not be selling the rice on a house-to-house basis. She is getting old so she needs to operate the business in a stall for a more comfortable way of continuously generating income for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
After his retirement from the military, Mohammad, a 58-year-old hardworking man, opened a mini-market to sell food products and kids’ snacks using his retirement salary.

Although Mohammad has a big family that includes six sons and three daughters, he was able to raise them and send them to college so that most of them are now employees who contribute to the family income, but he still has three members of the family who are under the age of 20.

Now Mohammad has applied for a loan to add new items to the mini-market inventory and re-organize the space to have a good expansion for it.

loans.use: To add new items for the mini-market.

loans.name: Bashiran's Group

texts.en:
Bashiran is 36 years old and spends most of her time in her home doing her household responsibilities. She is very efficient and performs her duties very well. 

Her husband has a business of loading & unloading. He has a donkey cart which he purchased on installments. Through his cart he offers goods transfer services to his clients. 

Bashiran is the mother of a daughter who is studying in class 5. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to pay off the remaining installments on his cart. This will make him the owner of the donkey cart and give him the motivation to work with more dedication. He is very experienced in his business and many people know about his services. 

Bashiran is hopeful that the loan will bring positive financial changes to her husband's business and improve the lifestyle of her family.

Note: One of the members has a clothes selling business thats why they are holding clothes.

loans.use: To pay off the remaining installments on a donkey cart.

loans.name: Yusufali

texts.ru: Юсуфали проживает в районе А. Джоми. Ему 44 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Его жена занимается домашним хозяйством. Сам Юсуфали занимается разведением крупнорогатого скота. Он в основном откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Yusufali lives in the A. Jomi region. He is 44 years old. He is married and has four children. His wife is taking care of the household. Yusufali does animal husbandry and breeds large horned cattle. He mainly feeds and sells the cattle. He is asking for a loan to buy large horned cattle.

loans.use: to buy large horned cattle

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Raising hogs is Teresita's primary source of income. She has been in this activity for 10 years. When the hogs are ready for disposal, Teresita sells them to the butchers who come down into their village. She usually earns 2,000 Philippines pesos (P) for each hog.

Teresita is now 61 years old and was proud to give a good education for all seven of her children by the income she generated from her business. As of now, they have their own families and good employment. Sometimes they help her in times of need. She doesn't want to rely on their remittances; that is why at her age, she still works hard to earn an income. 

She is now asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy feeds and vaccines for the hogs to ensure proper growth and good nutrition. 

In the future, she would like to strengthen her hog raising business in order to save for future expenses, especially as she gets older and older.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vaccines for the hogs.

loans.name: Nurali

texts.ru: Нурали проживает в районе Бохтар. Возраст, 40 лет. Женат. Имеет четверых детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он более 16 лет занимается животноводством. В основном он закупает крупнорогатый скот, разводит и через некоторое время продает. Кредит берет для закупа несколько голов бычков.
texts.en: Nurali lives in the Bohtar region. He is 40 years old. He is married and has four children. His wife is a homemaker. He has been in the animal husbandry business for more than sixteen years. He mainly buys large horned cattle, breeds and then sells after a period of time. He is taking out the loan to buy several heads of calves.

loans.use: to buy several heads of calves

loans.name: Ma. Nida

texts.en:
Ma. Nida is 46 years old and married. She has three children.

Ma. Nida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell her sari sari store.

Ma. Nida has borrowed and repaid loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 13 years and also earns an income from a cafeteria.

Ma. Nida aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries.to sell her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed and has three children. 

Catalina has a food shop or carenderia that sells viands like afritada, caldereta and bulalo. She has had this business for 13 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 14,000 to buy raw ingredients for cooking viands to sell.

Catalina has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Catalina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for cooking viands to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has eight children.
 
Susan has a shop that sells beverages, canned goods, snacks and bananas. She has had this business for 3 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 14,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and bananas for sale.

Susan has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Susan hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and bananas for sale.

loans.name: Emie

texts.en:
Emie is married and has three children. Emie is 54 years old and lives in Palomoc, Titay, Zamboanga del Norte.

Emie is a farmer and grows rubber to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase four sacks of fertilizer.

Emie has been a member of PMPC since 2011. In the future, Emie hopes to expand her rubber farm to plant other seedlings.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is married. Rosita is 47 years old and lives in Imelda, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Rosita owns a sari-sari (variety) store to earn a living and has had this business for three years. 

She has requested a loan for PHP 14,900 to purchase instant noodles, soap, sardines, Coke and other groceries to sell.

Rosita has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Rosita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase instant noodles, soap, sardines, Coke and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed for pigs and chicken.

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Rhodora is 41 years old and lives in Caloocan City, Philippines. Her husband Jesus is a mechanic and they have two children. She earns a living by selling household merchandise and cell phone credits. Most of her customers are neighbors, and she generates revenues of at least PHP 5,500 a week. She is applying for a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. Her dream is to provide her children with a high-quality education. One way she does that is by meeting with other borrowers who learn from each other, and by studying the Word of God. 

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rodina

texts.en: Rodina is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed and has two children. Rodina is making and selling snacks like rice and cheese cakes. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for 11,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks. Rodina has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rodina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks

loans.name: Nie

texts.en: Nie, 25 year olds, is a grocery seller and earns $7 per day. Her husband is a trader, buy and resell bamboo earns $10 per day. This couple has two children, they are 4 and 2 year olds. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $5 on electricity, $20 on transportation and $15 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy more grocery goods to sell in her store. Her family use to do farming before, but they change their career after they have children and enough money to start a new business. In the future, she wants to buy a plot of land near the road and build a small house to sell grocery. She also wants to send all of her children to study in the university when they can finish high school.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods to sell in her store

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is widowed and has two children. She is 23 years old and lives in Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Grace sells cake to earn a living; she has had this business for three years. She has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase cake flour to make cakes. Grace has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Grace hopes to have her own bakery in the town.

loans.use: To purchase cake flour

loans.name: Minh

texts.en: Minh is 28 years old and earns a living by farming and raising pigs. She earns about $2 per day while her husband works in construction and earns about $4 a day. They have one child, who is 10 years old and attends school. Every month, she spends about $30 on food, $6 on school fees, $10 on transportation and $10 on other expenses. She is applying for a loan for $500 to buy a motorbike for her husband to use when traveling to work. Minh used to work in a factory, but had to change occupations when she had a child and needed to stay closer to home. In the future, she would like to enlarge her herd of pigs and build an enclosure for them to live in.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is 50 years old, married, has three children and lives in the Philippines. For the last 15 years, she has earned a living as a farmer, raising mostly rice. She is applying for a loan for PHP 50,000 to buy fertilizer to use when she plants her next crop. She has been a member of PMPC for two months, and hopes to earn enough money from her farm to educate her children through the college level.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en: Cecile is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines, where she is married and raising one child. She earns a living by running a shop where she sells vegetables such as cabbage and tomatoes and beverages such as soft drinks. She has been in this line of work for five years and is applying for a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers. She joined HSPFI earlier this year and hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Guia

texts.en:
Guia is 54 years old and lives in Caloocan City, Philippines. Her husband works overseas and her one child has already graduated from college. She earns a living by running a variety store where she sells groceries, toiletries and beverages. Her customers are neighbors, and she brings in about PHP 360 in sales every day. She is applying for a loan for PHP 14,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. She is a faithful member of our group, attending meetings to learn about business and study the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay loans.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Genesia

texts.en: Genesia is 49 years old and lives in Poblacion, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is married, has three children and earns a living by selling snacks. She brings in about PHP 5,000 a month and is applying for a loan for PHP 50,000 to buy the ingredients she needs to make more snacks. She has been a member of PHP for four years and is working hard to make enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make snacks to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
This is Annaliza, 34, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Zaldy, a construction laborer, and mother to their children. Together with her husband, she manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Annaliza operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP350 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP14,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Annaliza hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mylin

texts.en:
Mylin is married and has two children. She is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Mylin is a farmer and grows rice to earn her living. She has been doing this for three years. She has requested a loan of PHP30,000 to purchase fertilizer for the rice plants. Mylin has been a member of PMPC for 11 years. In the future, Mylin hopes to send her children to school to obtain a college degree.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for the rice plants.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan, 52 years old, is a cake seller. Between her cake business and doing farming, she earns $5 per day. Her husband operates a motor taxi service, earning $3 per day. She has seven children: five are studying and two more are working in the factory, earning $8 per day for all. 

Every month, Chan spends $30 on food, $10 on school fees, $10 on transportation, and $15 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy a new motorbike for her husband’s career, because the previous motorbike is old and needs a lot of fixing. In the future, she wants to repair her house and to send her children to study in the university when they finish high school.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike for her husband's career.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feed for pigs.

loans.name: Kimatullo

texts.ru: Киматулло проживает в районе Бохтар. Ему 36 лет. Он женат. У него трое сыновей. Его жена предоставляет услугу, занимается шитьем платьев. А его дети учатся в средней школе. Сам Киматулло занимается животноводством. В этой области он уже четыре года. Он берет кредит для закупа телят, чтобы увеличить количество скота.
texts.en: Kimatullo lives in the Bohtar district.  He is 36 years old, married and has three sons.  His wife provides a service and is involved in sewing dresses.  And their children attend a secondary school.  Kimatullo is involved in animal husbandry.  He has been in this business for four years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of calves in order to increase livestock quantity.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Hean

texts.en:
Hean, 39 years old, is a crab and shrimp seller, earning $5 per day. Her husband is a farmer, earning $2 per day. She has four children: two are studying and two more are working. The working children earn $11 per day for all. 

Every month, Hean spends $30 on food, $3 on electricity, $10 on house rental fees, $10 on school fees, $15 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a motorbike for her son to travel to work. 

In the future, Hean wants buy more shrimp and crab to sell. For her children, she will trying to support them to study until they finish university.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her son to travel to work.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Vivian has a food shop that sells chicken & pork barbecue & banana kebabs. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy bananas and meat for making the barbecues & kebab.
Vivian has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Vivian hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas and meat for making barbecues & kebab

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is married with 3 children. Gina is 37 years old and lives in Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.
Gina sells barbecued meat to earn a living and has had this business for 4 years. She has requested a loan of 4,000 to purchase meat, the main ingredient for her barbecue business.
Gina has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Gina hopes to have several barbecue stalls in town.

loans.use: To purchase meat for her barbecue business.

loans.name: Rowel

texts.en:
This gentleman is from province of Isabela.  He raises pigs in their house.  He also works on the farm during cropping and planting season.

Rowel asking a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy feed and vitamins for his pigs. He has been in business for several years and says this loan will be used to raise pigs. He has sufficient experience in this type of work. His past loans have been important because they have helped to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for his pigs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Pepito

texts.en:
Pepito is a 53 year old married man.  He lives with his wife and children and is engaged in an agricultural business.  He keeps livestock. 

With the loan's help, Pepito will increase the number of livestock in his business and purchase feed and vitamins for his hog raising business.  That will help him raise quality pigs to sell in the future.  This will make Pepito's dream of having a big piggery farm come true.   Increased income means a brighter future for Pepito and his family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for the pigs

loans.name: Melgin

texts.en: Melgin is 23-year-old man who breeds pigs. He has 10 years of experience in this field. Melgin usually buys piglet and then raises and fattens them and resells them for a profitable price in the market town. He sells pig for meat. He is single. He would like to purchase more livestock for the future. For this purpose he applied of 17,000 PHP to buy feed and vitamins of his pigs.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for his livestock

loans.name: Lorenza Vanessa

texts.en:
Lorenza Vanessa is married with 1 child.  She is 23 years old, and lives in Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.
Lorenza has been running a piggery to earn a living for the last two years.   She has requested  loan of 4000 PHP to purchase pigs.
Lorenza Vanessa has been a member of PMPC for more than 1 year.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase pigs

location.town: Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Chariya

texts.en: Chariya is a grocery seller earns $5 per day. Her husband is working in the factory earns $3 per day. they have one child, he is one year old. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on rent house fee, $10 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy a motorbike for her husband traveling to work. She wants to buy more kind of goods to sell in her small grocery store when she could make good income.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband traveling to work

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en:
Elmer is a 43 year old married man.  He lives peacefully in the province of Isabela where he plants rice as the family's primary source of income.  Elmer is a hardworking man.  Apart from farming, Elmer manages his hog raising business, raising pigs for breeding.  His desire is to expand his business premises and grow the business.

Elmer is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which he will use to buy feed for the maintenance of his hogs.  His previous loan was invested in his business and had a positive impact.  He hopes this loan will help bring him additional income, which will help the entire family.  With this business, he is able to send his children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for his pig

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 5 children.  Noel has a food shop that makes & sells viands like caldereta, afritada & halang-halang.  He has had this business for 21 years. 

Noel has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for cooking viands.  He has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Noel hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for cooking viands

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
This is Lydia, 55, a resident of Bacoor, CaviteCity, Philippines. She is married to Jovencio, a construction worker, and has children. She manages her household while operating her own business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lydia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them retail. Aside from this she also retails charcoal. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 350 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php15,000 loan which she will use to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. Lydia dreams of giving her children a good and high quality education by working hard at her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery and other inventory for her store.

loans.name: Benedete

texts.en:
Benedete is 48 years old and is a mixed-crop farmer. She is married to David who is also a farmer. They are blessed with two children ages 20 and 15 years old respectively. She has been in this business for the past ten years with the monthly income of 10,000 KES which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan term with KADET Ltd. after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. She will use the loan to buy farm manure and seedlings for her farm. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will venture into pig keeping. 

Her hopes and dreams are to concentrate on pig keeping and keep pigs in large amounts, which will help increase the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy farm manure and seedlings for her farm

loans.name: Ros

texts.en:
Ros, 57, is a straightforward and hard-working woman. She lives with her lovely husband and three children. She is a resident of Kompong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. Her greatest wish is to get ahead in life, so she makes a great effort every day. 

She has been running a business as a farmer. She's been doing this job for 21 years. This work is her main source of income so she has dedicated her life to doing it well. As a result, she earns a good income from her work.

She would like to purchase a motorbike but she lacks the money so she wishes to apply for a loan through Kiva partner HKL. This is her third loan with HKL, and the first loan with Kiva. 

She promises to repay the loan faithfully. She is sure that she can count on the support of lenders so she can continue to prosper. She is very grateful to all lenders that always help her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Rudyliza

texts.en:
Rudyliza is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Rudyliza has a shop that sells fish like sardines and mackerel. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy fish to sell.

Rudyliza has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rudyliza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Samay

texts.en:
Samay, 30 years old, is a farmer who earns $3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns $5 per day. She has one child and he is one year old. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $10 on electricity, $20 on the house rent fee and $10 on other expenS..

She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a plot of land for doing farming. This loan will help her family to get a plot of land that can generate more rice to sell and get more income for supporting her family. In the future, she wants to feed pigs at home to sell.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land for doing farming

loans.name: Clarissa

texts.en:
This is Clarissa, 40, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Eddie, her partner in business, and is mother to their four children. She, together with husband and children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Clarissa operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 450 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Clarissa dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Pouen

texts.en:
Pouen, 44 years old, is a fish seller who earns $3 per day. Her husband is a fisher and earns $1 per day. This couple has four children: two are studying and two more are working, each earning $3 per day. Every month she has to spend $50 on food, $5 on electricity, $5 on school fees, $20 on transportation and $15 on other expenses.

She would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy a motorbike for her daughter traveling to work. Before, this couple sold food and drink but that business was not good so they changed to sell fish. In the future she wants to sell more fish and will support her children to study in the university.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her daughter traveling to work

loans.name: Genel

texts.en:
Genel is 26 years old and lives in Sangay Diot, Ozamis City. She is married, with one child. 

Genel has a load business. She has had this work for almost two years. She requested a loan of 14,999 to purchase load for her loading  business.

Genel has been a member of PMPC for two years.  In the future, Genel hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase load for her loading business.

location.town: Sangay Diot, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Mind

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is 54 years old and she practices mixed farming, She is a single mother of one child aged 20 years. She has been in the mixed crop farming business for the past ten years with the monthly income of KES 8,000 which she uses to support her family.


She is applying for her first loan from  KADET LTD, after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Beth will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her child. 

Her hopes and dreams are to venture into pig keeping which will enable her to educate her child up to university level and improve their living standard.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm.

loans.name: Neng

texts.en:
Neng is a broom seller earning $2 per day. Her husband is a construction worker earning $1.50 per day. They have three children; one is studying and two more are working each earning $3 per day. Every month, she has to spend $66 on food, $3 on electricity, $15 on rent, $3 on school fees, $15 on transportation and $10 on other expenses. 

Neng would like to request a loan of $800 to buy a new motorbike for her daughter to ride to work in Phnom Penh City. She never wants to change her career to another one because she is experienced in this career. For her last child, she will try to support him to study in the university.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for her daughter to travel to work.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is 35 years old. She is married to Francis, and together they have two children. She operates a fruit and vegetable stall in the town of Naivasha. She has been in the business for the last six years.  

Rachael was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers, and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell. In the future, Rachael hopes to open a big greengrocer shop.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 55 years old. She is a mixed-crop farmer and is married to Erastus, who is also a farmer. They are blessed with two children, ages 25 and 23. She has been a farmer for the past 10 years, earning a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), which she uses to support her family.

Lucy is applying for her first loan with KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Lucy will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will venture into pig keeping. Her hope is to keep pigs for a large amount, which will help increase the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm

loans.name: Bunsim

texts.en: Bunsim, 42 years old, is a farmer who earns $1 per day. She is a single mother and has three children, all of whom are working, each earning $3 per day. Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on housing rent, $20 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy a motorbike for her son and daughter to use for traveling to work. In the future, she wants to repair her house to make it better for living.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her son and daughter to use for traveling to work

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is 43 years old and married. He lives in the rural area of Isabela, where he is busy in his hog business, raising pigs to sell later on at the local market in his town. He also works as a farmer for additional income to provide for the needs of his family. 

Danilo is asking for a loan of 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy feed and vitamins for his pigs, to have quality meat. He dreams that when he sells his pigs in the future he'll be able to construct a house to have a convenient home for his family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for his pigs

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
An enterprising business lady, Eva is 50 years old. She is married to Ngugi. They are blessed with three children who are adults. She has been distributing donuts for the past 10 years, earning a monthly income of 5,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), which she uses to support her family.

Eva is applying for her second loan with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Eva will use the loan to buy sugar, wheat flour, and salt for making donuts. 

She will use the anticipated profit from the business as working capital. Her dream is to open a bakery shop.

loans.use: to buy sugar, wheat flour, and salt for making donuts

loans.name: Sinarn

texts.en: Sinarn is a grocery seller and earns $10 a day. Her husband is a farmer doing plantation and earns $3 per day. They have three children. Every month, Sinarn spends $50 on food, $5 on electricity, $5 on transportation, and $20 on other expenses. She is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy material to repair her house so that she can sell groceries and other items in her front yard. In the future, she wants to extend her business to sell more grocery items and support all of her children to study in the university.

loans.use: to purchase material to repair her house.

loans.name: Sary

texts.en:
Sary, 31-year-old mother of two children aged 10 and 5 years, is a garment factory worker earning $2 per day. Her husband transports water to sell, earning $6 per day. Every month, Sary spends $35 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses.

She is requesting a loan of $1000 to buy a new motorbike and cart for her husband to transport water to sell in the village. In the future, Sary wants to expand her husband’s business by buying more carts and motorbikes to transport water.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike and cart for her husband to transport water to sell.

loans.name: Arnulfo

texts.en:
Arnulfo lives in the rural area of the province of Isabela. He is 36 years, married and has four children. His wife is a homemaker. He has been involved in hog raising for four years. Arnulfo breeds his livestock for future sale. Besides this business, he works as a farmer as additional income for his family. He is requesting this loan to purchase sacks of feed and more vitamins for his pigs to maintain the quality.

In the future, Arnulfo dreams that someday he can build a big piggery farm to have a quality life for his family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for his pigs.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
This is Riza, 54, a resident of Baseco, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Edgardo, a truck driver, and mother to their children.  She, together with her husband and children, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Riza operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Aside from this she also earns additional income from rugs and accessories that she sells. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 250 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 9,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Riza hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Sevilla

texts.en:
Sevilla is 54 years old and lives in Sapang Dalaga. She is married with four children. 

To earn a living, Sevilla has a business selling snacks. She earns about PHP 3600 each month doing this type of work. Sevilla has requested a loan of 14,950 to purchase 2 sacks of flour and other ingredients.

Sevilla has been a member of PMPC for five years.

loans.use: To purchase two sacks of flour and other ingredients.

location.town: Sapang Ama Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, 71 and married to John, a farmer, is the mother of a 40-year-old. For the past ten years her primary business has been farming, earning her a monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family.

Introduced to KADET by a KADET staff member, Jane is applying for her first loan in order to buy seedlings and fertilizers for her farm. With the anticipated profit from the business she will venture into pig-keeping. Her dreams are to breed pigs in large quantities and be the distributor of pork in her home area so as to improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy, a 53-year-old mixed crop farmer for the past 10 years, is married to John, also a farmer, and they have been blessed with three children. She earns a monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family.

Having been introduced to KADET by an existing KADET customer, Lucy is requesting her first loan to buy manure and seedlings for her farm. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will venture into pig-keeping. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses which will help her improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy farm manure and seedlings.

loans.name: Ainur

texts.ru: Айнур – 54 года, замужем и имеет троих детей.  Айнур начала свой бизнес в животноводстве в 1999 году со стартового капитала в сумме 2,500 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день, Айнур, содержа в своем хозяйстве 2 коровы и 10 голов овец, имеет прибыль от продажи молока в сумме 9,000 сом  (KGS) в месяц.  В целях дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса, Айнур обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) для покупки скота.  Доходы от кредита она планирует направить на ремонт хозяйственных построек.
texts.en: Ainur is 54 years old, married and has three children.  She started her animal husbandry business in 1999 with a starting capital in the sum of 2,500 som (KGS).  Today, Ainur has two cows and ten sheep and earns a profit of 9,000 som (KGS) per month from the sales of milk.  In order to further expand her business, Ainur requested a loan in the sum of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company for the purchase of livestock.  She plans to use the profits from the loan to make repairs to farm buildings.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Arnulfo

texts.en: Arnulfo, a 42-year-old married father of two grown children, lives in the province of Isabela with his family. Arnulfo, who has been involved in agriculture and hog-raising  for seven years, is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy feed and vitamins for the pigs he plans to sell in the future. Arnulfo learned this business from his father, who is also involved in livestock-raising.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for his pigs.

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda is married with two children. She is 56 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental.

Minda sells cannned goods, noodles, toothpaste, coffee, and biscuits to earn a living and has had this business for 35 years. Each month, she earns 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 14,900 PHP to to purchase additional products to sell in her store.

Minda has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Minda hopes to save money, both for the future and in case of emergency.

loans.use: to purchase additional products for her store, such as cannned goods, noodles, toothpaste, coffee, and biscuits.

loans.name: Purisima

texts.en:
Purisima is a determined mother. She works tirelessly to generate income for her family. Her daily routine includes selling fruits, vegetables, and dried fish to the people in her village. She offers it on a house-to-house basis because she doesn't own a stall in the market. She has four children. Three of them are grown and the youngest still attends elementary school.

She is asking for a loan of 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy eggplant, tomatoes, cabbages, garlic, and dried fish to sell in the village and increase her sales. She hopes to earn consistent profits to achieve financial stability and save for the future education of her youngest child.

In the future, Purisima also wants to own a stall in the public market.

loans.use: to buy eggplant, tomatoes, cabbages, garlic, and dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josephine is 29 years old and an enterprising business lady. She and her husband Benson are blessed with two children who are 12 and 7 years old. She has been running a green grocer for the past 11 years with the monthly income of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES), which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her third loan term with KADET LTD after successfully repaying her previous loans. Josephine will use this loan to buy green vegetables, green maize, and fruits to add to her business stock for sale.

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a salon that will cater to her family’s needs.

loans.use: To buy green vegetables, green maize, and fruits to add to her business.

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.en:
Dinisio is a hardworking man. He is 38 years old and married. Dionisio has had a hog raising business for ten years. Aside from hog raising, he also farms. 

Dinisio raises pigs for additional income to support his family's daily needs. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy feed and vitamins to maintain the quality of his pigs for sale in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for his pigs.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a businessman who has a motorbike transport business. His business is only one year old. He has sustained his business because of the financial support from Faulu Kenya. His desire is to grow the business and buy a van for his transport business.

Samuel has requested 10,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy another motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Nelsa

texts.en:
This is Nelsa, 48, a resident of Baseco, Manila, Philippines. She and her husband Rogelio, a messenger, have three children. She, together with her husband and children, manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Nelsa operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages in small quantities to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 pesos worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by purchasing supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Aside from this she also earns additional income from rugs and accessories that she sells. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Nelsa hopes to be able to expand soon, and she dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en:
Arnold is a businessman who runs a salon and a barber shop. He has been in this business for six years and has employed three people including himself. Even though he runs his business in a competitive environment, he is able to retain his customers because of his good reputation.

Through Faulu Kenya, Arnold has been trained on business management skills. This has helped him to improve his business. He needs a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to open another barber shop.

loans.use: To open another barber shop.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 64 years old. She is a widow and has three children who attend school. She has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 36 years as her primary business.

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her fourth loan. She paid all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer to aid her in planting. In the future, Grace hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a conscientious and honest person. He is a farmer and is also involved in buying and selling livestock. George is married and is a loving father of three children. He has been involved in buying and selling livestock for over 12 years. 

George tries to provide good living conditions for his family and wants to place his children into good schools and universities. He wants to expand his business and receive a desired profit. George wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) for the purchase of livestock. He is grateful to all creditors in advance for the support and help.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for his pigs.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 26 years old and single. He has been running a barber shop for five years. He has employed two people in his business. Previously, he operated a salon.

Through Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to manage his business, which has helped it grow. He has also learned how to save his money.

Jackson hopes to open other outlets of his business in the future. He requests a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy a shaving machine.

loans.use: to buy a shaving machine

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores lives happily in her hometown of Estefania, Cagayan, together with her husband and five children. Though the family lives less fortunately than some, Dolores still aspires that someday she would lift her family out of poverty. 

With her patience and minimal capital, she established a hog raising business. She had been raising hogs for almost five years. When she sells them to the butchers who came in to their village, she usually earned 2,000 PHP for each hog she was able to dispose of. Profits gained from the business were just enough to cover their daily expenses, especially all her children's needs for daily allowances.

She is now asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for the hogs. With the help of this loan, she would provide enough sustenance and ensure good growth of her hogs.

In the future, Dolores wants to strengthen her hog raising business to save for the college education of her children and for them to have degrees someday, the only legacy she could pass on to them.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for the hogs

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is married with one child. Flora is 48 years old and lives in Lumbayao, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Flora sells bananas to earn a living and had this business for 35 years. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase 5 sacks of bananas to sell.

Flora has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Flora hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase 5 sacks of banana to sell

loans.name: Lhamsuren

texts.en:
Lhamsuren is 34 years old and lives with her 5 children and husband in a ger (a Mongolian yurt or tent) in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. Her children go to the high school and kindergarten. Her husband works at the local construction company.

She started her business in 2009 by selling meat at the local market. In the beginning, her turnover capital was equal to 200,000 MNT. Currently her turnover capital reached 600,000 MNT. She has been doing this business consistently. With her business profits, she bought a washing machine and refrigerator for her home. She is a hardworking and energetic woman who says, "I want to give the best knowledge and education to my children. At the least this is all I can do for them, so that my children can contribute to the development of our country."

She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase meat for her business.

loans.use: to purchase meat

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a business woman and is 57 years old. She is married and blessed with three children.

For the last nine years she has been rearing and selling chickens to earn a living. She has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business.

She is requesting a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy chickens.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Librada

texts.en:
Librada is 38 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Causwagan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is requesting a loan for 50,000 PHP to purchase stock for her general store.

Librada has been a member of PMPC for more than one year. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her general store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a business woman who is 25 years old. She is married and blessed with one child. For the last four years, she has been managing a retail shop to earn a living. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has become more business oriented and has grown her business.  In the next 5 years, she wants to manage a supermarket. She is requesting for a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy rice and sugar.

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Tsetsegmaa

texts.en: Tsetsegmaa is 42 years old and lives with her four children and husband in a ger in Hovd province of Mongolia. Her husband works as a security guard at the Oyu Mandal LLC's Children's Summer Camp. She started her business in 2011 by opening a fast food service. Before that she was a taxi driver. Currently her eldest son is a taxi driver. She pays 100,000 MNT for the building's rent. Her fast food service is located in a crowded place and that gives her a net profit between 20,000 MNT to 30,000 MNT. She is a diligent woman who says "After my son graduated from the driver's training course, I gave my car to him and started a new business." She is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan to purchase food supplies for her cafe.

loans.use: To purchase food supplies

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. 
Violeta has a shop that sells green & yellow bananas. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy bananas for sale.
Violeta has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Violeta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas for sale

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is 42 years old. She is a single mother of two school aged children. Farming is her primary business. She has been in the business for the past two years in Ndunyu Njeru.


She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers. This will be her second loan from KADET. She repaid her previous loan successfully. She will use this loan to pay school fees for her daughter. She hopes to be among the leading farmers in the area.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her daughter

loans.name: Yort

texts.en: Yort is 42 years old and earns $3 per day as a cake seller. Her husband is a farmer and he earns $2 per day. The couple has two childrE.. Both of them are working and each earn $3 per day. Every month, she has to spend $63 on food, $10 on electricity, $10 on transportation, and $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $400 to buy rice for making cakes to sell in Phnom Penh. Her career can provide a good income and she would like to make more cakes to sell.

loans.use: To buy rice for making cakes to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a hardworking businesswoman. She is 28 years old, married, and blessed with one child. For the last year, Esther has been managing a retail shop where she sells cereals to earn a living. Previously, she sold clothes. 

Esther is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy beans and maize. Within the next five years, she wants to manage a wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize

loans.name: Dorotia

texts.en:
Dorotia is 55 years old and married with five children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past six years, Dorotia has operated a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.

Dorotia is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en:
Chanthorn is 36 years old and is married to a construction worker. She is a weaver and she also sells baskets to earn 5 USD a day. Her husband earns 4 USD daily. Chanthorn has four children, two of whom are studying and two who are too young for school. Each month, she has to spend 63 USD on food, 10 USD on electricity, 15 USD on schools fees, 5 USD on transportation and 10 USD on other expenses.

Chanthorn is requesting a 600 USD loan to buy baskets from her villagers to sell in Phnom Penh where she can make good profit. Chanthorn's goal is to send all of her children to study in the university when they finish high school.

loans.use: to buy baskets to sell

loans.name: Purevsuren

texts.en:
Purevsuren is 38 years old and lives with his five children and wife in a ger, a traditional felt tent, in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. His children are all high school students and his wife has a private business. Purevsuren started his business in 2005 by selling dairy products at different places. In the beginning, his capital was 400,000 MNT. Currently, his capital has increased to 1,000,000 MNT. He has been doing this business consistently and has improved his family life with his profits. Purevsuren is a diligent and hard working man who says, “I want to give the best knowledge and education to my children. I also have a plan to buy an apartment.”

Purevsuren is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase dairy products and meat and sell them in Ulaanbaatar.

loans.use: to purchase dairy products and meat

loans.name: Nurgul's Group

texts.en:
Nurgul is the leader of this group. She is 45 and, unfortunately, she is a widow. She brings up two daughters and two sons; the daughters work in a sewing workshop in Bishkek, the first son studies at university, and the second son is at school. Nurgul works as a cleaner; six years ago her parents presented her a calf, and since that time she has also been engaged in cattle breeding. At the moment she keeps four cattle, and every day she sells about 7-8 liters of milk. In this way she earns about 2000 soms per month. With the money received from the loan, she wants to purchase a calf for breeding, fattening, and further reselling. In the near future, Nurgul plans to increase the number of her cattle up to ten, and with the profits gained from reselling cattle, she wants to repair her house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a calf.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a hardworking business man aged 40. He is married and blessed with one child. For the last three years, he has been practicing pig farming to earn a living. He also does dairy farming to supplement his income. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business to earn more income. He needs 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy pigs for his farm.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison is 30 years old.  He and his wife, Jane, have two children. He operates a retail shop in Naivasha. He has been in this business for the past three years.

Harrison was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers. This will be his third loan. He paid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy more goods like sugar, salt, flour, and soap for sale in his retail shop. In the future, Harrison hopes to grow his retail shop to wholesale.

loans.use: to buy more stock for sale in his .

loans.name: Zarifa

texts.ru: Зарифа умная честная и добросовестная женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать 4 детей. Более 19 лет она занимается купля продажей игрушки, фонарики, иголки, лампочки, крышки и т.д. Она любит свой бизнес и с удовольствием продолжает. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес и хочет получит хороший прибыль и улучшить своё жилищное условие. Зарифа хотела бы получить займ для покупки нового ассортимента товаров с целью увеличения и расширения товарооборота.
texts.en: Zarifa is a smart and conscientious woman.  She is married and is a loving mother of four children.  She has been involved in buying and selling toys, flashlights, needles, covers, etc. for over 19 years.  She loves her business and runs it with satisfaction.
