She wants to expand her business and make a good profit, and improve her living situation.  Zarifa wants to obtain a loan for the purchase of a new selection of merchandise in order to grow and expand her goods turnover.

loans.use: to buy a new selection of merchandise

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en: Sopheap is a basketmaker and sells her baskets from her home. She can earn $4 per day. Her husband is a construction worker. The couple has two children, 4 and 3 years old. Every month, Sopheap has to spend $53 on food, $10 on electricity, $5 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. She has requested a loan of $350 to buy a motorbike for her husband to use in traveling to work. She plans to buy more baskets from her fellow villagers to sell in Phnom Penh, so that she can make more income for her family. She hopes to support her children's studies until they finish university.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband's transportation to work.

loans.name: Norng

texts.en: Norng, 58 years old, is a yam planter in her fellow villager’s plantation. She earns $3 per day. Her husband works at the yam plantation as well, and earns $5 per day. They have three children, all of whom are working, each earning $4 per day. Every month, Norng has to spend $83 on food, $15 on electricity, $25 on transportation, and $15 on other expenses for the family. She has requested a loan of $600 to buy a small house to live in with her family. This loan can help provide a home for her family.

loans.use: to buy a small house to live in.

loans.name: Soy

texts.en:
Soy is a mother of four children who lives in Ornlong Veng District, Odor Meanchay Province, Cambodia. She is a rice farmer and has been in this business for the past six years. She earns a low monthly income from farming. Her present crop is not growing well because of the lack of fertilizer and increased weeds and insects in her farmland.

Soy is therefore requesting a loan through the Kiva partner HKL to purchase fertilizer and insecticide. This will be her first loan with HKL and she hopes her loan will increase her profit. In the future, she is hopes to have a bigger house. Soy is very grateful to all Kiva lenders who help her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Aisalkyn's Group

texts.en:
Aisalkyn is the leader of this group. She is 62, and together with her husband, who is a retiree, she has raised a son and two daughters. All the children are married. The daughters trade in the bazaar and the son is a farmer. In 1998, the family sold some part of the harvest and, with the profits gained, they purchased cattle. Since that time Aisalkyn has been breeding cattle and reselling it after fattening. Her husband and son help her in running the business. The monthly profit from this activity is about 3000 soms. With the money received from the loan, Aisalkyn wants to purchase more cattle for breeding, fattening, and reselling. In the future, Aisalkyn plans to repair her house with the profits gained from reselling cattle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia, 54 years old, is married and has 13 children. Ten are married and three are still single and working. Virginia lives with her husband and three children at the village of Wigan Cordon. Her husband earns an income working as a farmer within their village. The income generated by her husband is used to pay their electric bill and daily needs.

Virginia supports her family by running a general store and managing a school canteen. She has had this business for 20 years and she's glad for the increase of her income. She sells basic needs such as sugar, cooking oil, soft drinks, biscuits, and other household items to people in her community. The photo above was taken at the school canteen, because one week she stayed there from morning until 5:00 in the afternoon, while her husband was in charge in their home-based retail store. She would like to request a loan in the amount of P7,000 to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products to stock in her store, such as soft drinks, assorted biscuits, junk food, candies, eggs, ingredients, cooking oil, and milk, so that she can better satisfy her customers' needs.

Virginia hopes that she can run her business smoothly and generate a higher income in order to improve her family's living conditions and save some money for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, assorted biscuits, junk food, candies, eggs,ingredients, cooking oil, and milk for her retail store.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mom, 31 years old, is a farmer who earns $2 per day. Her husband is a yam seller and earns $5 per day. They have three children, two of whom are studying and one who works in the garment factory, earning $3 per day. Every month, Mom must spend $63 on food, $10 on electricity, $10 on school fee, $10 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $850 to buy potatoes to sell with her relatives. This loan will help her have the money to start a new career that can provide some profit for supporting her family. She plans to buy more potatoes to sell when she can find a good market.

loans.use: To buy potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Channy

texts.en: Channy, 27 years old, is a garment factory worker who earns $3 per day. Her husband is a driver and earns $5 per day. The couple has one child who is one year old. Every month, Channy has to spend $63 on food, $10 on electricity, $12 on transportation, and $15 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy potatoes to sell with her relatives. She plans to buy more potatoes to sell when she can find a good market.

loans.use: to buy potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Chhearng

texts.en:
Chhearng, 42, is the mother of six lovely children who lives in Ornlong Veng District, Ordor Meanchay Province, Cambodia. All of her children are single. For the past six years, Chhearng has been a rice farmer and she earns a low daily income. Her current rice crop is not growing well because of the lack of fertilizer and increased weeds and insects in her fields. 

Chhearng has therefore decided to request a loan through the Kiva partner HKL to purchase fertilizer and insecticide. This will be her first loan with HKL and she hopes that her loan will increase her profit. In the future, she is hoping to have a bigger house than she currently does. Chhearng is very grateful to all of the lenders who help her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Presella

texts.en:
This is Presella, 37, resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Israel, a checker in the port, and is also a mother. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Presella operates an LPG business. She buys Liquefied Petroleum Gas tanks from wholesalers and sells them per tank with a little profit. LPG tanks can range from small to regular size. Aside from this, Presella also retails electronic cell phone loads. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 200 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more LPG tanks to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Presella hopes her business will grow more this coming year and dreams of being able to give her children a good, high-quality education through all her hard work at her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God they study.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of Liquefied Petroleum Gas tanks for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood for repairing her house.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 28 years old, married to Nderitu, who is a businessman, and together they have one child. She runs a grocery that gives her a monthly income of 36,000 Kenyan shillings. She has been in the business for the past two years.

This is her first loan from KADET, which she plans to use to add stock to her business. She plans to establish a well stocked charcoal store with the anticipated profit from the business. Her dreams and hopes are to ensure her business is stable; thus, her family will have a stable income.

loans.use: to purchase more stock

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married with three school-age children. She is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. Josephine is a farmer and specializes in corn production to earn a living. Josephine has been in this business for three years. Josephine has requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos to purchase fertilizer. 

Josephine has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the near future, she hopes to make her business successful.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Regine

texts.en: Regine is 35 years old, married and has a five-year-old child. For the past seven years, she has been operating a mobile phone money transfer business to earn a living. In the same business premises, she sells African design fabric (kitenge). In addition, she bakes cakes and does event decorations. Regine has managed to run her business well because she has been trained in business management skills through Faulu Kenya. She needs a loan of 100,000 Kenyan shillings to buy African design fabric (kitenge).

loans.use: to buy African design fabric (kitenge)

loans.name: Lodivina

texts.en:
Lodivina is from the village of Cabisera 17-21. She is 35 years old. Lodivina is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 250 daily for these activities.

Lodivina is requesting a new loan of 21,000 PHP which will be used to buy canned goods, snack foods, drinks, and spices for her store. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snack foods, drinks and spices.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
This is Lourdes, 49, resident of Manila, Philippines. Her husband Rolando is the father of her three children. Together with her husband and children, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income to cover her everyday expenses.  

Lourdes maintains a direct-selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products of popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and others. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-payback credit term. Dealers' prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are counting on for their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She makes a minimum of 2000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 21, 000 loan. She will utilize the loan to buy more merchandise products to fill orders from her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Lourdes hopes to be more successful on her business and dreams to be able to give her children a good future and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise needed in her business.

loans.name: Arivnaa

texts.en: Arivnaa is 30 years old and lives with her parents and son in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her son is a first grade high school student. She started her business in 1997 by renting a commercial space at the local market for a hair salon. She took two business loans from XacBank previously. She has been serving at the same place for three years and has made many regular clients. In the future, she plans to expand her business and scope of service. She is a diligent and hardworking woman who says, "I want to expand my business and increase the number of clients. I also want to increase my income level and improve my life." She is requesting a 1,500,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) loan to buy new implements for her salon and increase her capital turnover.

loans.use: To buy new implements.

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah is 40 years old and single. She has rental houses that give her a monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan shillings. She has been in the business for the past 10 years.
 
This is her first loan with KADET. She will use the loan to build more houses for rent. With the anticipated profit, she plans to buy a piece of land to build more rental houses. In the near future, she hopes to build more houses in other parts of Kitengela.

loans.use: To build houses for rent.

loans.name: Danny Boy

texts.en:
Danny Boy is a 25-year-old single man. He lives in a permanent house in the village of Wigan Cordon. He is charged with the responsibility of looking after the family. His dream is to have a higher income for his transportation business. For one year, he has been managing his motorcycle transport business, and this has enabled him to provide for the daily needs for his family.

Since he is still single, he challenges himself by managing other kinds of business, including hog raising. He would like to buy feed stock and motorcycle parts, such as wheels, a sprocket and chain for his transportation services, but due to a shortage of income, he is asking for additional working capital of 5,000 Philippines pesos. He just hopes that he can make his business grow and provide his customer a quality service, most especially in transporting them to and from the market.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle parts such as wheels, a sprocket and chain for his transportation services.

loans.name: Un

texts.en:
Un is a 39-year-old woman who lives in Baray District of Kompong Tom Province. She is married and has three children. All of her children are single. Since 2000, Un has worked as a fish-seller and she earns 2 USD daily. Her husband is a fisherman, earning around 2.10 USD daily. 

Un is requesting a loan through the Kiva partner HKL to buy fishing equipment such as a small motor-driven fishing boat, nets, and fish traps. She hopes that her increased income will allow her to expand her farm. She hopes to use the remainder of her funds to renovate her old house and at least educate her children through high school.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat, nets, and fish traps

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 64 years old and lives in P-1 Embargo, Ozamiz City. She is married with 3 children. 
Rosario has a copra (dried coconut meat) buyer business and earns approximately PHP 10,000.00 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase copra for her retail business. 
Rosario has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Rosario hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase copra for her retail business

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Luisa owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Luisa has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Luisa is requesting a loan of 13,000 PHP to buy different personal products such as slippers, umbrellas etc. and also to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. 

 She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to buy slippers, umbrellas, and bags for her general store

loans.name: Amartuvshin

texts.en: Amartuvshin is 28 years old lives and with his parents and sister in a house in the Tosontsengel province of Mongolia. He started his business selling livestock to meat traders in 2010. He plans to continue his business operation and expand his business scope in his home town. He also plans to buy land and a yurt for his personal use and business development. He is a diligent man who says "I want to make my business successful with this bank loan. My dreams are to buy a car and have a successful business. I think I am on my way to accomplish my dreams." He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase livestock for his business.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Remelyn

texts.en:
Remelyn is 51 years old and lives in Olo, Siquijor. She is widowed with five children.

Remelyn displays fresh fish for a living. She has been doing this for 30 years. She has requested a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase fresh fish to sell every day.

Remelyn has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for 11 months. In the future, Remelyn hopes to uplift her living standard from being poor.

loans.use: To purchase fresh fish to sell every day.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 31 years old. He is married to Hannah and they have one child. He has practiced livestock farming in Naivasha town for the last five years.

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his fourth loan. He paid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more sheep to rear and sell later.

In the future, George hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy more sheep to rear.

loans.name: Eliphas

texts.en:
Eliphas is 33 years old. He is married with two children in school. He sells bed covers, bedsheets and curtains to earn a living. He has been in the business for six years. He has grown his business with his previous loans from Faulu Kenya. He hopes to grow his business into a wholesale one in five years.

Eliphas has requested a loan of 35,000 Kenya shillings to buy curtains and bed sheets.

loans.use: To buy curtains and bed sheets

loans.name: Kumrikhon

texts.ru: Кумрихон проживает в районе Вахдат. Ей 41 год. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Ее муж находится на заработках заграницей. Сама Кумрихон более 12 лет занимается торговлей. Она арендует торговую точку на рынке, где продает детскую одежду. Кредит берет для покупки ползунков, носков, шапок и костюмчиков.
texts.en: Kumrikhon lives in the Vahdat district.  She is 41 years old, married and has three children.  Her husband works abroad.  Kumrikhon has been involved in sales for over 12 years.  She leases a retail outlet at a market, where she sells children's clothing.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of infant pants, socks, hats and bodysuits.

loans.use: to purchase infant pants, socks, hats and bodysuits

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en: Ganbaatar is 49 years old and lives with his children and wife in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Tosontsengel Province in Mongolia. His children go to the local high school and kindergarden. He started his business in 2005 by planting vegetables. He sells vegetables and fruits in his hometown. He has many years of business and work experience. He admits that his business is expanding, and the amount of harvest is increasing as time goes by. His family members support him in managing the business. He is a hardworking and diligent man who says, "With bank loans, I am improving my business. I really want to expand my business in the future." He is requesting a 1,000,000-Mongolian-tugrik (MNT) loan to pay the storage rent for his vegetables.

loans.use: to pay the storage rent for his vegetables

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
This is Edelyn, 35, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Francisco, a porter, and is a mother to her children. Together with her husband and children, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Edelyn sells RTW clothes, towels, and blankets to her customers. A customer's order is bought in cash by her and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. She also sells water by the container to those in the community who don’t have access to it. She also earns additional income on her room rentals. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 2,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 16,000-PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more stock of personal merchandise to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Edelyn dreams of being able to give all her children a good future and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have a growing network of customers. She faithfully meets up with her fellowship co-members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise and products needed in her business

loans.name: Hikmatullo

texts.ru: Хиклатулло женат и любящий отец 4 детей. Он любит свою семью и хочет содержит их в хороших условиях жизни. Он занимается купля продажей хлебобулочных изделий. В основном он продает печенье,  вафли, конфеты и пряники. Хиклатулло хочет получить максимальный прибыль от данного бизнеса и расширить его. Он занимается этим бизнесом уже более 16 лет. Он хотел бы получить займ для пополнения своего товарооборота.
texts.en: Hikmatullo is married and is a loving father of four children.  He loves his family and wants to provide a good quality of life for them.  He is involved in buying and selling baked goods.  He primarily sells cookies, waffles, candy and pryaniks (spice cakes).  Hikmatullo wants to maximize his profits from this business and expand it.  He has been in this business for over 16 years.  He wants to obtain a loan to increase his product turnover.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of baked goods

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is from the village of Cabisera 17-21. She is 28 years old. Aida is married and has one infant child. She owns and operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Aida has been engaged in her business for two years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

Aida is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like coffee, sugar, spices, noodles, and drinks. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

loans.use: to buy noodles, drinks, coffee, and sugar for her store

loans.name: Fernalin

texts.en: Fernalin is married with one child. She is 36 years old and lives in Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Fernalin sells barbecue to earn a living and has had this business for one year. She has requested a loan of 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase meat as an ingredient for her barbecue vending. Fernalin has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Fernalin hopes to have a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase meat for her barbecue stall

loans.name: Victoire Ayaba's Group

texts.fr:
Mariée et mère de 4 enfants, Victoire vit dans la maison de son mari dans un quartier populeux de la capitale économique du Bénin. Elle est la responsable d'un groupe de 2 membres. 
Revendeuse, elle commercialise des sacs et chaussures qu'elle expose à la devanture de son domicile. Elle mène cette activité depuis 2007 et en maîtrise les contours. Victoire effectue ses approvisionnements tous les deux mois tantôt à Cotonou, tantôt à Lomé. 
Dans le but de réduire à la fois la fréquence et le coût d'approvisionnement afin de maximiser son profit d'une part mais aussi et surtout de satisfaire les attentes croissantes de ses clients, elle a sollicité un premier crédit à FINADEV. Elle compte en tirer un revenu supplémentaire afin d'accroitre le niveau de sa participation aux charges du foyer. 
Victoire est la caution solidaire de Pauline, une de ses amies de quartier qui commercialise des divers et céréales à son domicile aussi.
texts.en:
Married and the mother of four children, Victoire lives in her husband's house in a populous neighborhood of the economic capital of Bénin. She is the leader of a group of two members. As a small-scale retailer she sells handbags and shoes that she displays in front of her home. She has been in this business since 2007 and is well versed in it. She buys her wares every two months either in Cotonou or in  Lomé. 

Wishing to resupply her business less frequently and at a lesser expense so as to maximize her profit on the one hand but also mainly to satisfy the growing expectations of her customers, she is requesting a first loan from  FINADEV. She hopes in this way to get supplementary income in order to participate in a bigger way in covering household expenses. 

Victoire is the guarantor for Pauline, one of her neighborhood friends, who sells various items and cereals, also at her home.

loans.use: to buy 50 pairs of shoes and 10 school bags

loans.name: Ken

texts.en: Ken is 22 years old and single. He runs a barber shop so as to earn a living. He has been engaged in this business for three years and has employed one person. He has grown his business with his previous loans from Faulu Kenya. Ken hopes to open other branches of his business in the future. He has requested 30,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to open another barber shop.

loans.use: to open another barber shop

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria, from the village of Cabisera 17-21, is 39 years old, married and has three school-aged children. For over eight years Gloria has been raising pigs for fattening and sale, and is now requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase feed and vitamins as she raises her young pig for future sale. 

Gloria hopes to eventually expand her business to better support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pig.

loans.name: Muhabbat's Group

texts.en:
Muhabbat is the leader of this group. She is 47, and unfortunately, she is a widow. She has a son who is married and works in Russia. Muhabbat has been working as a post officer since 1990; her monthly salary is 3700 soms. In order to earn additional money to meet her daily needs, she breeds livestock. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase feed for livestock. In the future, Muhabbat wishes to build a new house.

Where Did This Loan Come From?

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase feed for livestock.

loans.name: Sharshenbek

texts.ru: Шаршенбеку 49 лет, женат, имеет 3 детей.  Шаршенбек занимается животноводством и полеводством с 2001 года, начав бизнес всего лишь с 1,000 сом.  Для развития своего хозяйства, в 2008 года Шаршенбек два раза обращался в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитами, которые были отработаны и погашены без просрочек.   Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Шаршенбек обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» в третий раз  за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для откорма.  Доходы от кредита Шаршенбек планирует отправить на дальнейшее увеличение количества скота, а также – на улучшение жилищных условий для своей семьи.
texts.en: Sharshenbek is 49 years old, married and has three children.  He has been involved in animal husbandry and farming since 2001 and started his business only with 1,000 som.  In order to develop his business, Sharshenbek obtained two loans from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company in 2008 and repaid both in a timely manner.  In order to further grow his business, Sharshenbek requested a loan in the sum of 135,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase calves for fattening up.  He plans use the profits from this loan to increase livestock quantity and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for fattening up

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret, a 62-year-old married mother of three children, has been practicing dairy farming to earn a living for five years. Previous loans from Faulu Kenya have enabled her to add cows to her farm, and she is now requesting a loan of  60,000 Kenya shillings to buy another dairy cow. Margaret hopes to practice large-scale farming in the future.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is from the village of Cabisera 17-21. She is 28 years old. Angelina is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Angelina owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Angelina has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

Angelina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like vinegar, soy sauce, rice and drinks for her sari-sari store (small store). Angelina is a very responsible mother and wife. She hopes that her store will be expand in the future.

loans.use: to buy vinegar, soy sauce, rice and drinks for her store.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
A hardworking woman who strives to provide for her family, Anita is a 40-year-old cattle breeder. She purchases and resells cattle with her husband.

Anita is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase feed and vitamins for her livestock to increase her inventory and to meet customer demand. She believes this will lead to greater revenue and ultimately greater profit for her family.

In the future, Anita would like to reinvest the earnings generated by this loan into her business. She will then purchase additional livestock and further increase her income.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her cattle.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 32 years old, married and has a two-year-old child.  

She runs a pub to earn a living. She has operated the business for one year.  

Through the training conducted by Faulu Kenya on business management skills, she has gained a lot of skills, hence improving her business.

Margaret hopes to open other outlets of her business in the future. She has requested 50,000 KES to buy beer and soda.

loans.use: To buy beer and soda.

loans.name: Kadycha's Group

texts.en:
Kadycha is the treasurer of this group. She is 59 and together with her husband, who is a retiree, she brings up two daughters. Both of them are students. 

In order to earn money to support the family, she cultivates agricultural products and breeds livestock. Selling some part of the harvest and reselling animals after fattening, the family earns about 7,000 KGS per month. With the profits gained from these activities Kadycha purchased a tractor. 

She applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase more livestock for breeding. In the future Kadycha wants to see her daughters married.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is from the village of Cabisera 17-21. She is 48 years old. Josie is married and has two adult children. 

Josie owns and operates a business venture raising pigs for fattening and sale. Josie has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP when she sells a raised pig.

Josie is a very kind and understanding person. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets for her business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a focused businessman, age 66. He is married and blessed with one child. 

For the last ten years, he has been managing a tailoring business to make a living. He has grown his business since he joined Faulu Kenya. He hopes to stabilize his business within five years.  

He is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy fabric.

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Kanipa's Group

texts.en:
Kanipa is the treasurer of this group. She is 49 and, unfortunately, she is a widow. She has a daughter and a son. The son works in Russia and the daughter studies at school. 

In order to earn money, Kanipa breeds livestock. At the moment, she is keeping three goats and a cow. She also takes orders and sews Kyrgyz national pillows and blankets. In this way, she earns 1,000 KGS per month. 

With money received from the loan she wants to purchase materials needed for sewing. In the future she wants to see her children wed.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase materials for sewing.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a businessman. He is married and blessed with four children who are still in school. 

For the last seven years, he has been selling onions to earn a living. He has grown his business with his previous loans from Faulu Kenya. 

He is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to install electricity in his business premises.

loans.use: To install electricity in his business.

loans.name: Simplicia

texts.en:
Simplicia is from the village of Cabisera 17-21, province of Isabela. She is 60 years old. Simplicia is married and has three adult children. 

Simplicia makes general household furniture and sells it to local businesses and community members. Simplicia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

The purpose of the loan is to purchase raw materials like nail, varnish, wood and wood glue for her furniture to make additional income. 

Simplicia is requesting 16,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy nails, varnish, wood and wood glue for her furniture business.

loans.name: Evason

texts.en:
Evason is 40 years old, married and the father of one child, age 8.

He hawks shoes around Makupa, Mombasa. He has been in this business for the last six years.

This is his first loan from KADET. With this loan, Evason plans to add more stock of shoes for resale. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to expand his business.

His dream is to own and run several shoe outlets.

loans.use: To add more stock of shoes.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a hardworking businessman. For the last three years, he has been selling home-made soap. Previously, he used to sell clothes. 

In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. His dream is to grow his business and register it as a company. 

He is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy industrial salt as a raw material for making soap.

loans.use: To buy industrial salt as a raw material for making soap.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is a hardworking businessman, age 26, and he is single. 

For the last five years, he has been repairing electronics to earn a living. He also sells clothes to earn more income. He has employed three people to help him to manage the business. 

In the next five years, he wants to manage a wholesale business. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 KES to buy speakers and television spare parts.

loans.use: To buy speakers and television spare parts.

loans.name: Abdumanon

texts.ru: Абдуманон женат и у них 4 детей. Он целеустремленный и честный человек. Он занимается купля продажей муки в центральном рынке города. Он любит свой бизнес и у него очень хороший опыт. Более 13 лет он занимается этим бизнесом. Абдуманон любит свою семью и старается всегда обеспечит их и содержит в хороших условиях жизни. Он хотел бы получит займ в размере 9000 Сомони для покупки муки с целью расширения бизнеса и пополнения оборотного капитала.
texts.en: Abdumanon is married and has four children.  He is a goal-oriented and honest person.  He is involved in buying and selling flour at the central city market.  He loves his business and has a very good experience.  He has been in this business for over 13 years.  Abdumanon loves his family and always tries to support them and provide a good quality of life for them.  He wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 9000 Somoni for the purchase for flour in order to expand his business and refill his revolving capital.

loans.use: to buy flour

loans.name: Efficacité Plus Group

texts.en:
Horace is the leader of a Community bank named “Efficacité Plus”, which is composed of 22 micro-entrepreneurs united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC, with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Horace, 35 and married, sells prepaid cards. He has been in business since 1997. With hard work and good management, he has been able to stabilize his business by delivering prepaid cards in order to increase his working capital. He makes a profit of about $20 daily. Horace’s ambition is to become a prepaid cards provider in his area. As he wants to develop his business, he has decided to join one of Hope’s groups. He is planning with the next loan to purchase dozens of prepaid cards and resell them at a profit. Horace has five children whose ages vary between 9 months and 9 years old. Two of them attend school.

loans.use: to purchase dozens of prepaid cards to resell in order to increase his working capital.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Florabel

texts.en:
Florabel is 39 years of age and is married. Her husband is an operator of a van providing transportation services to passengers. Florabel and her husband are blessed with three children who are currently attending school. One is in college while the other two are both at the high school level of education.

Florabel has always desired to help her husband move their family out of poverty, and the couple does their best to attain that goal. She engages herself in a retail business in which she sells bananas, vegetables, pears and other fruits.

She dreams of hog raising and having a sari-sari (variety) store business but she doesn’t have enough capital to make it happen. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of P12,000 to buy additional vegetables and fruits to sell in their village. She hopes to expand her business after receiving the loan.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables and fruits to sell in the village.

loans.name: Tursunbubu

texts.ru: Турсунбубу 51 год, замужем и имеет пятерых взрослых детей.  Начав бизнес в животноводстве около 20 лет назад, Турсунбубу добилась успеха – на сегодняшний день ее хозяйство насчитывает скот на общую сумму 160,000 сом (KGS). Такое развитие бизнеса стало возможным благодаря упорному труду семьи Турсунбубу, хорошему уходу за скотом, включая соответсвующий ветеринарный уход и хорошие условия содержания. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Турсунбубу обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS)на покупку скота. За счет доходов от полученного кредита, Турсунбубу сможет провести ремонт своего дома.
texts.en: Tursunbubu is 51 years old, married and has five grown children. Having started a livestock business about 20 years ago, Tursunbubu has become successful—today the combined value of all   livestock on her farm is 160,000 KGS. This business growth was possible due to hard work by Tursunbubu and her family, who  their good care of the animals, including providing appropriate  veterinary care and keeping the naimals comfortable.  In order to develop her business further, Tursunbubu turned to  Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan in the amount of 80,000 RGS to buy cattle. Thanks to the income made possible by this loan, Tursunbubu will be able to have her house repaired.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 55 years old and married. His wife works as an assistant accounts clerk for the Masindi town council. He has five children, all attending school. He has his own residential house and a family dream of educating all his children up to university. 

Patrick has a drug shop where he has been in business for twelve years. His hardships in the business are daily price changes, and his dream is to own a pharmacy. The purpose of the loan is to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Akram

texts.ru: Акрам умный и честный человек. Он женат и ответственный отец 3 детей.  Он занимается купля продажей скот. Он знал данный бизнес с детство, и он мечтал, открыт свой маленький бизнес. Более 5 лет он успешно продолжает данный бизнес. До этого времени во всем помогал ему его отец и с помощью отца он купил старый дом, и теперь он хочет от своего бизнеса перестроить дом и отремонтировать  двор по своему вкусу по новому стилю. Акрам хотел бы получить займ в размере 2200$ США для покупки бычков с целью расширения бизнеса и получения максимальной прибыли.
texts.en: Akram is a smart and honest person.  He is married and is a responsible father of three children.  He is involved in buying and selling livestock.  Akram has known this business since childhood and dreamt of opening his own small business.  He has been successfully running this business for over five years.  Until now, his father helped him with everything, and Akram was able to buy an old house with his father's help.  Now Akram wants to use his business income to rebuild this house and redo his yard according to his own taste and new style.  Akram wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $2200 for the purchase of calves in order to expand his business and maximize his profits.

loans.use: to purchase calves and expand his business

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina is proud to share that through the income she earns from the direct selling of cosmetics she can provide the daily allowances for her three children in school. Now, two children have finished their college, hold degrees and are professionals.
 
Florentina is 53 years of age and happy to say that she is married to a farmer. She dreams of finishing her youngest child to her college level of education, and that's why she is keeping on selling make up, face powder, lipstick and eyeliner. She learned this type of business through friends and relatives. She is proud that she has been 11 years in this business. 

Florentina is asking for a loan of P12,000 to buy lotion, shampoo, fragrances and eye shadow. She hopes to meet the demands of her customers around their village and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy lotion, shampoo, fragrances and eye shadow.

loans.name: Mabongisi Y Nkolo Plus Group

texts.en:
Vuvu is the leader of the Community Bank named “Mabongisi ya Nkolo Plus” which is composed of 12 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Vuvu is 41 and married, and has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 2004. She operates a general store to the west of Kinshasa. She has acquired solid experience in this area and works hard with good management skills in order to realize her dream of one day opening two large stores in Kinshasa. She would also like to achieve financial independence through her business that earns about $80 per week. She works to the best of her abilities and uses her contacts so that she might achieve her goals. 

She is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having three times obtained and correctly repaid loans. She will increase her stock of merchandise with her next loan by buying sacks of rice, sugar and milk and reselling them at a profit. Vuvu has seven children between the ages of 6 and 22 years old. All of them attend school.

loans.use: to increase the store’s stock by buying some sacks of rice, sugar and milk and reselling them at a profit.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Rapheal

texts.en: Raphael is 42 years old, married with 5 children between the ages of 3 and 20, living in his own house in Hoima, Uganda. For eleven years he has been in a furniture business, and he also sells timber. He faces the challenge of poor road networks while transporting the raw materials, thus creating high production costs. His dream is to have a well established furniture shop. Rapheal needs the loan facility to buy timber for furniture making.

loans.use: to buy timber for furniture making.

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en: Immaculate is 25 years old, married with 3 children between the ages of 6 months and 5 years, living in her own house in Hoima, Uganda. She has been operating a cosmetics shop for 1 year despite the challenge of price fluctuations. Her dream is to have a wholesale shop. Immaculate needs the loan facility to buy cosmetics for resale.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Jursun's Group

texts.en:
Jursun is the treasurer of this group. She is 59, and unfortunately she is a widow. She is bringing up a fourteen year old, who studies at school. Jursun cultivates agricultural products, and by selling some part of the harvest she earns money to meet their daily needs. 

At the moment, Jursun’s son works in Russia in Sochi. Two years ago he transferred his mom 15,000 soms, and with that amount Jursun started to breed livestock.  She applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase hay for her livestock. In the future Jursun wants to provide her daughter with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase hay for livestock.

loans.name: Heaz

texts.en: Heaz is 42 years old, married with 5 children between the ages of 22 and 3, living in his own house in Hoima, Uganda. He has rental houses and has been in the business for 8 years. He faces a challenge of defaulters which affects his business profits. His dream is to have four houses for rent. Heaz needs a loan to renovate his rental houses.

loans.use: to renovate the rental houses.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca and her husband have only one child who is presently taking the college level of education. Rebecca is now 45 years old and is married. Her husband works abroad somewhere in part of the Middle East as a furniture maker. Rebecca lives happily with her child, but she would be happier if they could live with her husband.

She does her best to develop her sari-sari (variety) store business. She manages her business well to help her husband in financing their needs. She hopes that someday she will make her sari-sari store into a large grocery, with many various commodities to sell.

Rebecca is requesting a loan of P12,000 to purchase canned goods, snack foods, drinks and spices to sell in her sari-sari store, which is located in front of their house.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, snack foods, drinks and spices to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Ruzigul

texts.ru: Рузигул занимается купля продажей продукты питания. Она разведена и у неё 4 детей. Она сама кормит своих детей с помощью данного бизнеса. Ей тяжело содержит свою семью в хороших условиях. Она продает ежедневные продуты такие как масло, сахар, макароны, напитки, а также порошок, носки мыло и т.д. Рузигул хочет расширить свой бизнес и с этой целью запрашивает займ в размере 2000$ США. Она заранее благодарна всем кредиторам за их помощь и поощрения.
texts.en: Ruzigul is involved in buying and selling food products.  She is divorced and has four children.  She supports her children by herself with the help of this business.  It is difficult for her to provide good conditions for her family.  Ruzigul sells everyday products, such as oil, sugar, pasta, drinks and also detergent, socks, soap, etc.  Ruzigul wants to expand her business and is requesting a loan in the sum of $2000 for this purpose.  She is grateful to all creditors in advance for their help and support.

loans.use: to purchase food products

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a hardworking businessman aged 38. He is married and blessed with three children who are still in school. For the last five years, he has been selling fish to earn a living. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has become more business-oriented.  In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to build permanent business premises.

loans.use: To build permanent business premises.

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
At the age of 23, Minerva got married. She did not finish her college because she married early. Minerva does not feel regret at her early marriage and at not finishing her education because she is married to a loving and responsible man. They strive to give the opportunity to their children by sending them to school.

Minerva has been in different businesses like selling fruit and vegetables but she much prefers to sell home products like plates, glasses, bowls and table cloths. Minerva dreams of putting up a mini-bakery but she has insufficient capital to make it happen. She continues to work hard and earn a higher income to prepare for putting up what she dreams of.

Minerva is seeking a loan of P10,000 to buy additional plates, glasses, bowls, ladles, spoons and forks to sell. Minerva hopes to see her children finish their education and became professionals someday, through the income she earns from the business.

loans.use: to buy additional plates, glasses, bowls, ladles, spoons and forks to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice  and maize to sell.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is a determined business-lady aged 35, single, and blessed with four children who are still in school. For the last five years, she has been practicing dairy farming to earn a living. She has improved her business since she joined Faulu Kenya.  In the next five years, she wants to become successful in her business. She is requesting for a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Kermenbai

texts.ru: Керменбаю 55 лет, женат и воспитывает одного сына. Керменбай в своей деревне Сай известен  как человек  упорный,  трудолюбивый и оптимистичный . После развала Советского Союза, семья Керменбая занялась частным предпринимательством – разведением скота со стартовым капиталом в сумме 10,000 советских рублей.  На сегодняшний день, развитое хозяйство  Керменбая дает прибыль около 20,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи мяса, молока, кефира и др.молочных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Керменбай обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров.  Прибыль от кредита Керманбай планирует направить на покупку большого сарая с земельным участком.
texts.en: Kermenbai is 55 years old, he is married and is raising one son. Kermenbai is known in his village of Sai as a persistent, hardworking and optimistic man. After the collapse of the Soviet Union Kermenbai's family has started they own business by breeding cattle with a starting capital of 10,000 soviet rubles. Right now the developed business of Kermenbai brings a profit of around 20,000 som (KGS) a month from sales of meat, milk, kefir (thick yogurt drink) and other milk products. With the purpose to further develop his business Kermenbai has come to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of $100,000 som (KGS) to buy milk cows. Kermenbai plans to use the profit from the loan to buy a large cattle shed with a plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: Martin is a businessman aged 39. He is married and blessed with  three children who are still in school. For the last six years, he has been managing a welding business to earn a living. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has learnt how to save his money and manage his business.  In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy metal sheets and welding rods.

loans.use: To buy  sheet metal and welding rods.

loans.name: Augustine

texts.fr:
Augustine est mariée et a 6 enfants à charges. Elle réside dans sa propre maison dans une banlieue à l'Ouest de Cotonou, la capitale économique du Bénin. 
Elle commercialise des céréales, de l'igname et des divers dans une boutique installée à son domicile. Elle mène cette activité depuis 1995 et en maîtrise tous les contours. Augustine fait ses achats dans les marchés des villages de production des produits. 
Au terme de son 2ème crédit et face à la demande croissante de ses clients, elle a sollicité FINADEV pour un renouvellement. Avec le présent prêt, elle pourra effectuer des achats en gros afin de réduire à la fois la fréquence et le coût d'approvisionnement et maximiser son profit. Le revenu supplémentaire engendré par ce crédit lui permettra d'améliorer sa participation aux charges du foyer et faire face aux besoins grandissants de son ménage.
texts.en:
Augustine is married and raising six children. She lives in her own home in a suburb in the west of Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. She sells cereals, cocoyams, and various items in a little shop located in her home. She has been in this business since 1995 and is well versed in it. She buys her merchandise in the marketplaces of villages where the items are produced. 

Having arrived at the end of her second loan term and faced with growing demand from her customers, she has asked FINADEV to renew her loan. With this current loan, she will be able to buy wholesale so as to reduce both the frequency and the cost of resupplying her business and thus maximize her profit. 

The supplementary income generated by this loan will allow her to contribute more to supporting her household and to deal with its growing needs.

loans.use: to buy 40 sacks of cereals and 20 sacks of cocoyams.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 26-year-old young man. He is married and has a DJ project which is very well known in the area where he lives. Mohammad wants to improve his work and purchase new amplifiers to get better sound quality in the  concerts he performs. Mohammad has an amount of money which is not enough to pay for the amplifiers, so he needs to take a loan of $3,000 from FATEN. 

When Mohammad gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will pay to purchase the amplifiers he needs for the concerts. In this way he will improve his project and increase his income to live with his family in better living conditions. Mohammad is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase amplifiers for his DJ project.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
At 48, Trinidad is getting older. She wants to expand her hog raising and add a rice-selling business. Trinidad has been running a hog raising business for two years. She wants to maintain it and increase her income to save some of it for her future and her family. Trinidad's husband is a rice mill operator together with their relatives. 

Trinidad and her husband are blessed with four children who are in college and high school. Trinidad's husband's income goes for their household and daily food. Thus, she is asking for a loan of P6,000 to buy feed for her pigs and to start selling rice in their village.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs and to start selling rice in their village.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 23 years old married with one child aged two years, living in his own house in Hoima, Uganda. He has been in a butchery business for three years and this has facilitated him in paying school fees for his young brother. He faces a challenge of meat going bad due to poor preservation methods and his dream is a modern butcher shop that has all facilities. John needs the loan to buy cows for slaughtering in his butcher shop.

loans.use: to buy cows for his butcher shop.

loans.name: Dilmurod

texts.ru: Дилмурод умный и целеустремленный человек. Он женат и любящий отец 3 детей. Дилмурод занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Он любить свой бизнес и с удовольствием занимается этим бизнесом. Его жена также помогает мужу и она занимается выращиванием и продажей сельхоз культур.  В бизнесе также помогает ему его старший брат. Дилмурод хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить хороший прибыль для улучшения своего жилищное условие. Дилмурод хотел бы получить займ для покупки минеральных удобрений и семена.
texts.en: Dilmurod is a smart and purposeful man. He is married and is a loving father of three children. Dilmurod grows agriculture crops. He loves his business and does it with pleasure. His wife also helps him to grow and sell the crops. His older brother also helps him with the business. Dilmurod wants to expand his business and get more profit to improve his living conditions. Dilmurod wants to get a loan to buy mineral fertilizer and seeds.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is in her forties. She is married and blessed with four children. Two are in school while the other two have temporarily stopped their education because of lack of financial means. They just finished their high school education. Daisy is peacefully living with her children and husband in the province of Isabela.

Daisy is engaged in a vending business in which she sells bitter gourd, string beans and tomatoes. Daisy wishes to increase her income to further support her family needs, hence she is asking for a loan of P7,000 to buy additional vegetables to sell like squash, sponge gourd and eggplant to increase her sales.

Daisy is looking towards the success of her business soon.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell like squash, sponge gourds and eggplant.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 31-year-old a business lady; she is married to Patrick. They are blessed with two children aged 17 and 12. She has been running a mobile clinic for the past three years with the monthly income of KES 40,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her second loan with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Mary will use the loan to buy medicine and open a permanent clinic. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a mini-shop in the future, which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy medicine and use the rest to open a permanent clinic.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sheets, curtains, televisions and different products to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy manure and seedlings for her farm.

loans.name: Isaiyah

texts.en:
Isaiyah has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 11 years.  He is 47 years old, married to Tabitha, and they have two school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his sixth loan.  He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Isaiyah hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 11 years.  She is 51 years old, married to Sospeter, and they have two school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her second loan.  She repaid her previous loan of Kshs 15,000 well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy a dairy cow.

In future, Hannah hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Resty

texts.en: Resty is a forty-six-year-old single mother of five children, renting a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in second-hand clothes for seventeen years. She started with 130,000 shillings and now has 3,500,000 shillings as her working capital. Her hardship is limited funds to meet the different demands of her customers and her vision is to have a boutique, educate her children plus having her own house. Resty needs the loan facility to buy used clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a thirty-six-year-old married woman with four children and she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling clothes for ten years and she acquired capital to start her own business from her husband’s business profits. Her hardship is theft and her vision is to operate from enclosed premises plus educating her children. Mary needs the loan facility to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Asifiwe Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kavira, leader du groupe d’affaire «Asifiwe », est  entrepreneur, âgée de 40  ans, mariée, mère de 5 jeunes enfants, qui étudient. Son mari est un chauffeur dans un organisme. Elle est  vendeuse d’huile de palmes. Elle installe ses marchandises au marché communal Nyabushongo. Il y a 10 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  8 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Son premier capital fut 100$ reçu de son mari. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  5 fus d’huile de palmes à  marchander.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement  et agrandir son entreprise.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
The client, Kavira, the leader of the business group "Asifiwe", is an entrepreneur, 40 years old, married, mother of 5 young children, who study. Her husband is a driver in an organization. She is a seller of palm oil. She sets up her merchandise at the Nyabushongo communal market. 

Ten years have passed in which she has been carrying on small revenue-generating activities such as this. However, she has completed 8 loan cycles with Hekima. Her first capital was $100 received from her husband. The new loan serves to supply her with 5 casks of palm oil to sell. Further, she wishes to see her children grow up comfortably and to grow her enterprise. The client thanks Hekima for its actions in favor of poor women excluded by traditional banks.

loans.use: to pay for 5 casks of palm oil

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last nine years.  He is 46 years old, married to Hannah, and they have three school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount as capital to open up a shoe shop.

In future, David hopes to grow as a farmer and also as a shoe retailer.

loans.use: To open a shoe shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last seven years.  He is 36 years old, married to Cecilia, and they have three school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD  by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan.  He repaid both his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy a dairy cow.

In future, Andrew hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years. She is 32 years old, married to John and they have three school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her fifth loan. She paid all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Gladys hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Kandelesia Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Esther and the Kendelesia group in Chwele!  Esther is the Kendelesia group facilitator.  She and her group have just finished harvesting the maize from the recent season, and are in preparations for the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Esther and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Esther and her co-group members rely on maize as their main staple crop and a key source of income throughout the year. 

Esther takes care of five children at home with her husband. She joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits to help her educate her children. In the recent 2011 season, Esther had a good maize yield harvesting 6 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Esther was only able to harvest 1 bag of maize on 1/2 acre of land.  As she has more than doubled her harvest through the One Acre Fund program, Esther has been able to improve her family's financial stability.

With income from the maize sales, Esther will educate her children and invest in her business.

In 2012, the members of Kendelesia group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a 41-year-old married man with three children and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. The responsibility of looking after the family is vested in him and his desire is to educate his children up to university level. 

Henry has been operating a stationery shop for four years. He acquired capital for the shop from farming. His hardship is inflation and his vision is setting up a bookshop. Henry needs the loan facility to buy books and reams of paper for sale.

loans.use: To buy books and reams of paper for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Mathew is 28 years old, married, and has two children who attend school.  He has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for one year. 

Mathew was introduced to KADET LTD by one of the field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. In the future, Mathew hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Harriet's Group

texts.en:
Harriet's group is comprised of three hard-working women. Harriet is 19 years old and lives in the town of Natete in the Kampala West region of Uganda. For the past six months, Harriet has been working hard to manage her small catering business, where she sells fruits and delivers hot meals to local families and businesses. 

To help expand her business, Harriet has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more supplies and will help Harriet to generate greater profits and pay school fees. Harriet hopes that in the future she will be able to be a radio reporter. 

Harriet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life skills training. The ELA program has increased Harriet's future prospects by helping her to pay her school fees and learn more about running a business.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies,

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a forty-eight year-old married man with five children and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda.  He has been in the transport sector for five years.  He got the money to buy the car from the savings from his farm produce.  His challenges are accidents and lack of spare parts, due to their expensive nature. 

Stephen needs the loan to buy tires for his car.

loans.use: To buy tires for his car.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael, 20 years old, has practiced small scale farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last two years.

He was introduced to KADET LTD. by one of the field officers, and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.  In the future, Michael hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Cathy's Group

texts.en:
Cathy's group is comprised of 4 hard-working women. Cathy is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala North region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, 2 of  whom are currently in school. For the past year, Cathy has been working hard to manage her small catering business, which delivers hot meals to local families and businesses. 

To help expand her business, Cathy has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy chicken and cooking oil, and will help Cathy to generate greater profits and take care of herself. Cathy hopes that in the future she will be able to open her own retail business. 

Cathy is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Cathy's future prospects by helping her to face the many challenges of growing a business.

loans.use: to buy chicken and cooking oil,

loans.name: Abesamihigo A / Rsz Group

texts.fr:
Jean Bosco fait partie du groupe Abesamihigo A / RSZ. Le nom du groupe signifie « performers ». Il est marié avec 8 enfants de 6 à 25 ans, dont 8 scolarisés. 

Jean Bosco est cultivateur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques et payer la main d’œuvre pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser des engrais chimiques, cultiver peu d’espace et récolter une grande quantité. Dans les prochaines années, Jean Bosco voudrait être parmi les meilleurs cultivateurs de riz dans sa vallée. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer ses enfants et s’autofinancer.
texts.en:
Jean Bosco belongs to the group Abesamihigo A/RSZ. The name of the group means “performers.” He is married with eight children ranging in age from six to 25 years, eight of whom attend school. 

Jean Bosco is a rice farmer.  This is his second loan cycle with ACB.  He is going to use his loan to buy chemical fertilizer and to pay those who help him cultivate his rice. 

His strategy to grow his business is to use the chemical fertilizers in order to harvest a large quantity of rice in a small space.  In the years to come, Jean Bosco would like to be among the best rice growers the valley.  With his profits, he foresees being able to pay for his children’s education and to be financially independent.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and to pay labor costs in his rice cultivation business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase meat, fish, food products and imported merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos has operated in the transport industry in Naivasha town for the last six years. He is 37 years old, married to Jennifer, and they have two children. 
He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend, and this will be his third loan. He paid for all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy a new motorcycle. 

In the future, Amos hopes to buy a minibus for transportation

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel, 24 years old, has operated in the transport industry in Nakuru town for the last two years.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to buy a new motorcycle.  In the future, Samuel hopes to buy a taxi, which has more income compared to a motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a businessman who is 37 years old.  He is married and blessed with one child. For the last five weeks, he has been managing a taxi transport business to make a living. He also sells clothes. In the next 5 years, he wants to buy another car. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 Kenya shillings to buy spare parts for his car.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his car

loans.name: Pilicila

texts.en: Pilicila is 60 years old, married, and has five children.  She is a hardworking business woman.  For the last five years, she has been running a grocery selling beans and potatoes to earn a living. Previously, she was a dairy farmer. In the next five years, Pilicila wants to become the supplier of potatoes in her region. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 KES, which she will use to buy potatoes and beans.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes and beans.

loans.name: Barbara's Group

texts.en:
