Ana started selling boiled beans three months ago. She now sells boiled beans (like the ones that are canned) and fried rounds maD. of flour, a very popular item especially in fried food stalls. She will use her portion of this loan to buy beans, flour, cooking oil, butter, eggs, ham, cheese, charcoal, etc.

Ana plans to reinvest her profits in her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy beans, flour, cooking oil, charcoal, etc.

loans.name: Monte De Bendicion 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Midely is a member of her group "Monte D. Bendicion" (Mount of Blessing). Her group is located in the area surrounding Santo Domingo, one of the poorest area in the capital where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable.

Midely is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She will use this loan to buy underwear and pants (women's and men's). She is taking this loan to start her business. She was invited to join this group because the other members knew that Miledy was wondering how to start a business but she was needing capital to begin.  She is using her business profits to reinvest in her business.

Midely  makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and her child. She says that her biggest challenge is to finish building her house. She said her most favorite activity is walking with her son. She dreams of having her house built and living safe and tranquil. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy underwear and pants.

loans.name: Hul

texts.en:
This borrower is Hul, from Kompong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is 29 years old and is married with one child who lives under her care. Presently, Hul works as a tailor in a market near her village. She earns approximately 3 USD daily and has had her business since 2000. Hul has a lot of experience as a tailor and has a good reputation along with a deep understanding of local consumer needs. Her shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

Hul would like to expand her business and purchase more cloth, but she lacks capital. She is requesting a loan through the Kiva partner HKL to purchase materials. Her future goals are to increase her profits to provide a better life for her whole family and she wishes to send her child to get a good education and have a better job and future.

loans.use: to purchase cloth

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.en:
Edgardo is 60 years old and lives in Medallo, Sapang Dalaga. He is married with eight children. 

Edgardo has a shop that sells charcoal. He has had this business for 28 years. He requested a loan  to purchase charcoal for his retail business.

Edgardo has been a member of PMPC for six years.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal for his retail business.

loans.name: Satya Laksana Group

texts.en:
The Satya Laksana group got a loan for the 4th time. The number of members is 14 and the total loan amounts to Rp.21,000,000. Having been successful with maintaining one sow, Ni Ketut will use this loan to purchase four types of local pigs for pork. She will maintain them for two months. Any remainder of the loan will be used to fix the cage for the preparation of new deliveries of two sows that she already owns. 

The price of pig feed is currently very expensive, but Ni Ketut remains optimistic about her business going forward. With all the benefits she gets, she plans to repair the home and also save for the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase four types of local pigs.

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
At the age of 35, Sheila already has two children ages 16 and 13 who attend school. To generate income, Sheila sells beauty products from a catalog to her customers in the village. Her spouse also works as a local farmer. 

She is now asking for a loan of P3,000 to buy cologne, lotion, powder and cosmetics to sell in the village. It would help increase her sales.

In the future, she would like to continue growing as an entrepreneur and enable her family to live comfortably.

loans.use: to buy cologne, lotion, powder and cosmetics to sell in the village.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan is a 28-year-old married woman who lives in Ornlong Veng District, Odor Meancheay Province, Cambodia. She is a rice farmer who earns a small daily income. Her husband is a soldier who must pay for a daily taxi to commute to his workplace. Chan and her husband have discussed this financial problem and she is requesting a loan through the Kiva partner HKL to purchase a motorbike. This lovely couple hopes that this loan will decrease their monthly expenses and allow them to gain more profit. They are very grateful to all the kind donors who provide funds to their family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Tol

texts.en:
Mrs. Tol is a 38-year-old married woman who currently resides in Baray District of Kompong Tom Province. She is married to Mr. Ry and they have 2 children. The children are single, but one of them is now living apart from the family, working as a laborer in Korea.

Presently, Tol and her husband are cultivators as well as fishermen. They can earn about 8 USD per day to support their family's living condition. She would like to request a loan from HKL and Kiva in order to purchase a piece of fertile land to enlarge her farming business both in rainy and dry seasons.

From her loan, Tol hopes that she’ll use the increased income to expand her house size and send her youngest child to be educated in a university and earn a degree.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of fertile land

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 39 years old and a married woman having three children. She has been engaged in a hog-raising business for 18 years. According to her, she is in charge of caring for their children because her husband is away due to his work. She would like to improve her hog-raising business to be able to provide for the needs of her children and send them to higher levels of education. 

Sonia would like to make her dreams come true by asking for additional working capital amounting to P6,000. This amount would really help her to attain her dream in life. She will be using her requested loan in buying feed for her piglets. She hopes that her raised piglets will sell for a higher price so that she can cover their daily needs and pay their monthly electric bills.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hog-raising business.

loans.name: Zholdoshbek

texts.ru: Жолдошбек – 41-летний фермер, живущий со своей семьей в селе Жерге -Тал (север Кыргызстана).  Он воспитывает 5 детей школьного возраста  – трех сыновей и двух дочерей.  В 1993 году, в поисках средств к существованию для своей семьи, Жолдошбек начал бизнес в откорме и перепродаже скота.  Стартовав с начальной суммой в 3,000 сом (KGS), Жолдошбек сумел развить хозяйство с ежемесячным доходом в сумме 5,000 сом (KGS). Также жена Жолдошбека  - Айнагуль торгует в маленьком продуктовом павильоне , приносящий дополнительный доход семье. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса , Жолдошбек обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Жолдошбек планирует направить на постройку большого дома для своей семьи.
texts.en: Zholdoshbek is a 41-year-old farmer, living with his family in the Zhergetal village (Northern Kyrgyzstan).  He is raising five school-age children: three sons and two daughters.  In search of sources of income for his family, Zholdoshbek started a business of fattening up and reselling livestock in 1993.  Starting with a sum of 3,000 som (KGS), Zholdoshbek was able to develop his farm to have a monthly income of 5,000 som (KGS).  Also, Zholdoshbek's wife, Aynagul, is involved in retail sales at a small food stall, and this brings in additional income for the family.  To further develop his business, Zholdoshbek requested a loan in the of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase livestock.  He plans to use the profits from this loan to build a big house for his family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 35 years old and lives with her three school-aged children in the province of Isabela. Maribel describes herself as being an exacting, punctual woman.



She works with the help of her husband in her store, a business she started twenty years ago. She is requesting a loan of 22,000 PHP. The loan she’s requesting at present is to buy merchandise for her store. With this supply of merchandise she will increase sales and income at the same time. Her dream is to enlarge the store, implementing more services to obtain higher income.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snack foods, spices and drinks for her store.

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
From Reussey Keo commune of Phnom Penh, Mrs. Im is a 60-year-old poor woman who tries to earn money to upgrade her standard of living. She has two single children, one of whom is employed in the garment factory as a domestic sewing worker and has a formal salary per month, while the other one is married and lives in a separate house.

Mrs. Im makes a daily income by selling different kinds of dry fish in the mobile place. From this, she is earning a profit approximately of 2.50 USD per day. She has many years experience in this business. As a result, she frequently gets more clients who come to order her dry fish to eat. She has a life partner in her husband who works in the construction field as a chief of building workers. In order to add extra-income, Mrs. Im would like to borrow some loan funds from Kiva to purchase additional dry fish to sell.

In the future plan, Mrs. Im will be using the net income to raise her current business, and also to decorate her old house.

loans.use: to purchase additional dry fish to sell

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita is 58 years old with six grown-up children. Emerita has been selling groceries for over two years. She requests a loan of 11,000 PHP  in order to purchase merchandise such as canned goods, candies, noodles and sugar.

She wishes to sell a wider variety of goods, because her customers have been asking for this kind of merchandise and it will be much better for her. This way she will get more income for her family and she will be able to provide education for her child who is a college student.

She plans to repay the loan with part of the profits she makes from her business, since it's her source of income.

loans.use: to buy bread, candies, canned goods, noodles and sugar.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime is married with one child. Jaime is 45 years old and lives in Cabilinan, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur.  To earn a living, Jaime is engaged in a transportation business, serving in his community and he had been in this kind  of business for seven years. Each month, he earns PHP 4,000 doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of Php 12,000 to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle and a portion of his loan will go to purchase additional goods to sell in his sari-sari (general) store.

Jaime has been a member of GDMPC for one year.  In the future, Jaime  hopes to purchase another motorcycle for transport.


About GDMPC: 

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

GDMPC: people empowering people.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: But

texts.en: Mrs. But is a young mother of two children. She is an honest and goal-oriented woman. She supports her children on her own and has a hard time satisfying all of the needs of her children, and always needs support. She decided to deal with these difficulties by getting involved in selling soft drinks, hard drinks, food products and grocery goods. To upgrade her living, Mrs. But wishes to apply for a loan from HKL and Kiva. She will use this loan to purchase more goods to sell. She thanks everyone in advance for the support her business. The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Aigul's Group

texts.en:
Aigul is the leader of this group. She is 47 and unfortunately she is a widow. She is bringing up a daughter and two sons; the younger son studies at school and the other children are at university. In order to earn money for their livelihood, Aigul sells fruits and vegetables. She started this activity eleven years ago with an initial investment of 3000 soms and at the moment her monthly profit is 6000 soms per month.  

With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase more fruit and vegetables to sell.  Aigul will use some part of the loan to pay her daughter’s tuition at university. In the future she wants to give her children a good education and wishes to build a new house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Delgersaihan

texts.en:
Delgersaihan is 42 years old and lives with his children and wife in a 'ger' in Hovd province of Mongolia. Three of his children are college students and one child is a high school student. His wife is selling dairy products, especially milk, for the fifth year. 

Delgersaihan started his business in 2009 by selling wood and coal. Before that, he was a security guard. His business is very profitable during the wintertime and the dairy products trade is also profitable in summertime. He is a diligent man who says "Currently our expenses are quite high due to the college tuition fees of three children and other such costs. Thus, this loan will help me to manage these issues effectively." He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase coal and wood and will store them while the demand and price are low.

loans.use: To purchase coal and wood.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is leading the agricultural business of the family, particularly in hog raising. She has had this business for four years and she is able to generate an income of P1,000 for each piglet. Aside from the hog raising business, she also has rice farming which is managed by her husband. 

Teresita is requesting her ninth loan in the amount of P10,000 to purchase feed for the daily maintenance of her hogs.She needs to feed them three times a day so that she can sell them at a greater price. She plans to increase her profit in the hog raising business so that she can let her children finish their studies and sustain their daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase feed for the daily maintenance of her hogs.

loans.name: Boldoo

texts.en:
Boldoo is forty years old and lives with his five children and wife in a ger in Hovd province in Mongolia. His wife stays at home, his eldest daughter has a part-time job, and his other daughter is a college student. One son is a high school student and the other attends kindergarten. He is a diligent and accountable man.

Boldoo started a carpentry business in 2008. In 2010 he bought a car and became a taxi driver. He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase car repair equipment and materials so as to build a body shop.

Boldoo says, "There are many people who have body shops at their homes. I also have learned that a taxi service brings in a sufficient and consistent amount of income daily. Thus, I want to combine these two efficiently and offer the best quality service to my clients."

In the future, Boldoo plans to open a car body shop at his place.

loans.use: to purchase car repair equipment and materials.

loans.name: Misiratkhan's Group

texts.en:
Misiratkhan is fifty and married to a farmer. Together with her husband she has raised a son and five daughters. The son is a farmer, two younger daughters work in Russia and the other daughters are married and live separately with their families.

Misiratkhan farms rice and corn as well as breeding and reselling livestock after fattening them. In this way she earns money to meet the family’s daily needs.

Misiratkhan is the leader of this group. With her portion of this loan she wants to purchase two sheep for breeding and hire labor for harvesting her crops.

In the future Misiratkhan wishes to see her younger daughters get married.

loans.use: to purchase two sheep for breeding and hire labor for harvesting her crops.

loans.name: Douen

texts.en:
Douen, 56 years old, is a housewife. Her husband is a farmer who earns $2 a day. She has two children, one of whom is studying while the other works, earning $3 a day. Every month Douen must spend $30 on food, $2 on electricity, $10 on school fees, $3 on transportation and $10 on other expenses.

Douen wants to sell groceries from home when she has enough money. She is now requesting a loan of $1,000 to build a fence around her house.

Douen's wish is to help her younger child at least to finish high school.

loans.use: to build a fence around her house.

loans.name: Zinnatkhan's Group

texts.en:
Zinnatkhan is the leader of this group. She is 32 and brings up three children. Her husband works in Russia and the children study at school. Sixteen years ago with an initial investment of 5000 soms, Zinnatkhan started to breed livestock. At the moment, she keeps a cow with a calf and 15 sheep. In case she needs money to meet the family needs, she can sell some animals.  With money received from the loan, Zinnatkhan wants to purchase three more sheep to increase the number of livestock. In the future with the profits gained from reselling livestock, she plans to repair her house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Lhagvasuren

texts.en: Lhagvasuren is 31 years old and lives with his children and wife in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Hovd province of Mongolia. His wife works at the local ice cream factory and sells foods at the local market during her holidays. His two sons are high school students. He started his business in 2006 by driving a taxi. He is still driving his taxi. In May 2011, he began to sell car spare parts at the local market. He has many years of technical and business experience. So far, his business turnover is increasing in a short time and it has reached 3,000,000 MNT. He is a diligent man who says, "I want to expand my business operation, especially the car spare parts trade." He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase spare parts from Ulaanbaatar city.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts from Ulaanbaatar

loans.name: Hing

texts.en: Hing, 41 years old, is a farmer who earns $1 per day. Her husband is a motor taxi driver who earns $5 per day. They have three children, two are studying and one is working in the garment factory earning  $2.50 per day. Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $5 on school fees, $5 on transportation, and $6 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy a motorbike for her daughter to use to travel to work. She plans to have a new career besides doing farming but now doesn’t know what kind of career she can do yet. For her children, she wants to support them to study and at least finish high school.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her daughter

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Зульфия проживает в районе Вахдат. Ей 52 года. Она замужем. У нее один ребенок. Ее муж и сын занимаются ремонтом автомашин. Сама она занимается торговлей на рынке. Арендует торговую точку, где продает носки. Сейчас Зульфия берет кредит для приобретения мужского и женского нижнего белья. Она хочет увеличить ассортимент своего товара.
texts.en: Zulfiya lives in the Vahdat region. She is 52 years old. She is married and has one child. Her husband and son repair vehicles. She sells on the market. She rents out a space where she sells socks. Right now Zulfiya is taking out the loan to buy men's and women's underwear. She wants to increase the assortment of her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's underwear.

loans.name: Kouen

texts.en:
Kouen, 29 years old, has three children, all of whom are studying. She works in a garment factory, earning $2.50 a day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns $5 a day. Every month this couple has to spend $55 on food, $7 on rent, $9 on school fees, $3 on transportation, and $5 on other expenses.

Kouen is requesting a loan of $800 to buy pigs to fatten and sell. This loan will help her family to establish a new source of income which will help support them. If this venture succeeds, she will buy more pigs to fatten and sell.

loans.use: to buy pigs to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Gnek

texts.en: This borrower is from Baray District of Kompong Thom Province, Cambodia.  Gnek is 30 years old, married and has two children who are attending  school.  She and her husband are experienced rice farmers. This is a skill which they have learned from their ancestors. From this business sector, they can earn approximately $5USD per day. To expand their business, they would like to purchase a plowing machine but they lack the money so they are requesting a loan through HKL, a Kiva partner. They will use the loan funds to buy a plow and to plow their farm and will be employed to plow their neighbor’s farm. These funds will be very useful to their family. Their big hope for the future is that all of their  children will have a good education and have good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase a plowing machine.

loans.name: Odgerel

texts.en:
Odgerel is 24 years old and lives with his daughter and wife in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Hovd province in Mongolia. His wife is unemployed and stays at home.

Odgerel started working in 2008 at Tsahiur Mandal LLC as a carpenter. His profession is in high demand from April to October but in low demand from December to March. Besides being a carpenter, he also drives a taxi. He earns 200,000 MNT per month from his taxi service.

Odgerel is requesting a 1,600,000 MNT loan to make the payment on his taxi. He wants to become an independent carpenter with the income from his taxi service and Tsahiur Mandal salary. He is a diligent man who asserts, "I want to open my own private business very much."

loans.use: to make the payment on his taxi.

loans.name: Rouen

texts.en:
Rouen, 61 years old, is married and has one child who is 22 years old and works in a hotel earning $2 a day. A child in the picture is her grand son. Rouen and her husband sell food and drink, earning $20 per day. Every month the family spends $75 on food, $15 on electricity, $30 on transportation and $10 on other expenses. 

Rouen would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy souvenirs for her child to sell and furniture for her own business. She would buy more chairs and tables for her own customers and will help her daughter to buy more souvenirs to sell if the market for them is good.

loans.use: to buy souvenirs for her child to sell and furniture for her own business.

loans.name: Duk

texts.en:
Farming is the top one of many sectors in Cambodia.   Duk is a person who earns a low-income from this business. She has learned this skill from her parents . She and her husband who is a taxi driver have three children. Her husband has an income of about $5 a day.

Her children always pay for a motor taxi when they need to go to school or anywhere in and around their village. To reduce  traveling costs, Duk has decided to request a loan from HKL partner with Kiva in order to purchase a new motorcycle for her children to use to drive to school as well as for traveling needs. Mrs. Duk hopes she will use the funds saved to enlarge her house and to help her children to finish a high level of education.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle for her children to drive to school.

loans.name: Samol

texts.en: Samol, 35 years old, is a motor taxi driver earning $6 per day. His wife is staying at home and taking care of their one child. The child is one year old. Every month, he has to spend $50 on food, $25 on transportation and $10 on other expenses. He would like to request a loan of $700 to buy fertilizer and hire some farmers to plow his field for farming. Before, he was a construction worker and his wife was selling fruit at the market but now she stopped selling because she just had a baby and needs to take care of him. He plans to help his wife sell fruit when their son can attend kindergarten.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire some farmers to plow his field

loans.name: Myagmardorj

texts.en: Myagmardorj is 49 years old and lives with his daughter and wife in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Hovd province of Mongolia. His wife works at the local landscaping office. His daughter is a high school student. He started his business in 2000 by selling wood and coal at the local market. He came from the countryside to the town after selling his livestock and animals. In 2006, he took a loan of 300,000 MNT from XacBank and successfully expanded his business. As of today, he owns a sales booth in which he can sell wood and coal at the local market. He is a diligent man who says, "I want to increase my business and income as well so that I can build a house for my family." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase wood and coal for the winter sales.

loans.use: To purchase wood and coal

loans.name: Suvann

texts.en: Suvann, 24 years old, gives massages and earns $7 per day. She has one child who is three years old. She lives with one sister who works for a company and earns $3.50 per day. Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $5 on electricity and $30 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike to use to travel to work. Before, she went to work by bicycle with her sister, but it was hard for them and that’s why they decided to borrow some money to buy a motorbike. She plans to sell fish in the market instead of working because she can find a good market for selling fish, but she doesn’t have enough money yet to start that business.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Pleav

texts.en: Pleav, 46 years old, is a pig feeder who earns $5 per day. Her husband is a road repairer who earns $5.50 per day. They have two children, both of whom are studying. Every month, she has to spend $99 on food, $10 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy pigs to feed. This loan can help her family to have enough money to buy pigs to feed because they don’t have enough money to buy them. If they borrow from their neighbor, they have to pay a lot of interest. She plans to feed more pigs when she earns a good profit this time. For her children, she wants to help them to study at the university when they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy pigs to feed

loans.name: Hoy

texts.en: Hoy, 53 years old, is a weaver who earns $1 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns $5 per day. They have four children. Three of the children are working as construction workers, each earning $3 per day and the last child is only five years old. Every month, she has to spend $80 on food, $15 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $300 to buy pigs to feed at home. This loan will help her to have a new career that can make some profit to support her family. She plans to feed more pigs when she gets good profit from feeding them this time.

loans.use: To buy pigs to feed at home

loans.name: Shakhlohon

texts.ru: Шахлохон 45 лет, вдова и имеет двух детей.  В поисках постоянного источника дохода  для своих детей, 10 лет назад Шахлохон начала заниматься животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду и настойчивости, Шахлохон сумела развить свое хозяйство с ежемесячным доходом  около 15,000 сом (KGS) и насчитывающее на сегодняшний день 4 голов коров и 2 голов нетели.  В поисках дополнительного источника прибыли для своей семьи, инициативная Шахлохон также начала торговать одеждой на местном рынке, что позволяет ей покрыть ежедневные расходы.  Для дальнейшего развития животноводства, Шахлохон обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку крупного рогатого скота. В будущем, Шахлохон планирует подготовить хорошее приданое для своей дочери благодаря доходам от кредита.
texts.en: Shakhlohon is 45 years old, a widow and has two children.  In search of a consistent income for her children, Shakhlohon became involved in animal husbandry ten years ago.  Thanks to her hard work and persistence, she was able to develop her farm to yield a monthly income of about 15,000 som (KGS) and have four cows and two heifers today.  To find an additional source of profit for her family, entrepreneurial Shakhlohon also started to sell clothing at the local market, and this allows her to cover daily expenses.  To further develop her animal husbandry business, she requested a loan in the sum of 120,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase cattle.  In the future, Shakhlohon plans to prepare a good dowry for her daughter, thanks to the profits from the loan.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: Fred is 37 years old and married with four children living in a rented house in Masindi, Uganda. Fred operates a shop and he has been in the business for five months. Fred started with 300,000 shillings but now has stock worth over 1,000,000 shillings. He has a challenge of the current inflation, which has led to high costs of operation and his dream is to own a wholesale shop. The purpose of the loan is to buy more shop items like sugar, salt, cooking oil, soap, matchboxes and curry powder to sell.

loans.use: To buy sugar, salt, cooking oil, soap, matchboxes and curry powder to sell.

loans.name: Phary

texts.en:
Phary is 59 years old and is a primary teacher who earns $2.60 per day. She is a single mother living with two children -- one is a driver who earns $5 per day and one is a football athlete at the national protection ministry and earns $4 per day. Every month, she has to spend $60 on food, $10 on electricity, and $15 on other expenses. 

Phary would liK. to request a loan of $1200 to buy a plot of land near her house. She plans to sell tamarind wholesale on the land that she bought after she obtained this loan.

loans.use: buy a plot of land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy grocery items to resell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 49 years old and has three children attending school.   The primary source of her income comes from selling kitchenware to people in her village and the nearby towns. Her other source of income comes from raising hogs for future sales. By selling basins, hangers and baskets, she usually earns about PHP 4,000 each month.

Elizabeth has insufficient funds to diversify her business.  That is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional kitchenware to sell such as stock pots, basins, chairs and plastic mats.

She needs to earn consistent profits to save for the college education for her children.

loans.use: buy kitchenware

loans.name: Bargigul

texts.ru: Баргигул проживает в районе Вахдат. Она замужем. Ей 42 года. У нее четверо детей. Ее муж работает в редакции. Сама Баргигул занимается шитьем. Она берет заказы на дому. В основном Баргигул шьет национальные платья. Этим видом деятельности она занимается более 20 лет. Она берет кредит для покупки тканей и пуговиц. Баргигул в дальнейшем хочет открыть мини цех для расширения своей деятельности.
texts.en: Bargigul lives in the Vahdat district.  She is 42 years old, married and has four children.  Her husband works for a publishing house.  Bargigul is involved in sewing and fulfills her work orders at home.  She primarily sews national dresses and has been in this business for over 20 years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of fabrics and buttons.  Bargigul wants to open a mini-factory for her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and buttons

loans.name: Melchor

texts.en:
It is a big responsibility to be the head of the family. Melchor is 50 years of age and is married. His wife does direct selling of cosmetics, while Melchor operates his tricycle for passengers’ transportation. They are blessed with three children who they are currently sending to school. Melchor is also a barangay official in their village.

It is quite rare in the Philippines that a man is the one who will borrow a loan that will pay weekly amortizations, but Melchor doing this to make his tricycle comfortable transportation for his passengers. The couple wants to bring up their children and be able to send them to school until they finish their college level of education.

Melchor is looking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy tricycle wheels, tires and accessories for his tricycle. He hopes to beautify his tricycle and to increase his earnings from his tricycle.

loans.use: buy tricycle wheels, tires and accessories

loans.name: Kwt Sawe Permata Indah Group

texts.en:
KWT (groups of women farmers) Sawe Permata Indah is a group of women in the village Sawe, West Bali who have a wide range of businesses including shops, commercial food vendors, farmers and services. They are joined in groups to get a loan for business and training from MUK.

Agung Ayu uses her loans to increase business capital to buy more crops to sell such as banana, cocoa, coconut, jackfruit, etc. She will buy from farmers around the village and once collected, sell at the market. To transport the merchandise to the market, she uses a motorcycle. With its advantages, she dreams of buying a car to support her efforts.

loans.use: To buy banana, cocoa, coconut and other crops

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth had been managing her business of hauling junk and other waste materials for almost 10 years. She is now 51 years old and has three children. She usually earns an income of PHP 6,000 in this field of activities. 

Elizabeth wants to earn additional income, so she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more used bottles, newspapers and magazines to sell.  In the future, she wants to continuously generate income to make her family more economically stable.

loans.use: to buy used bottles, newspapers and magazines to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married.

Helen has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

Helen has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a plot in town

loans.name: Proserfina

texts.en:
Proserfina is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated. 

Proserfina has a shop that sells canned goods & snacks.  She is also into buying and selling wood & lumber in different sizes. She has had this business for 4 years. 

Proserfina requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy snacks & canned goods to sell & also to buy stocks of wood & lumber to sell.  She has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Proserfina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy snacks, canned goods, and lumber

loans.name: Larry

texts.en:
Larry is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Larry has a shop that sells green & yellow bananas per kilogram. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy green & yellow bananas to sell.

Larry has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: buy bananas to resell

loans.name: Avelino

texts.en:
Avelino is a 61-year-old married man with 1 child. He is a farmer working in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. He primarily grows rice crops to sell. Avelino works hard to improve his business and income. He wants to be able to buy all that his family needs.

Avelino has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. Avelino hopes for this loan to help improve his harvest.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza, a 38-year-old married mother of three children, lives in Dinas Sinacaban Misamis Occidental where, for the last 11 years, she has raised goats to sell to the Municipal Public Market. Her net monthly income of PHP 3,000.00 enables her to send her children to school.

A member of Gata Daku MPC for four years, Analiza has requested a loan for Php 3,000 to purchase additional goats to raise. In the future, she wishes to have a large goat farm, as she currently has only five goats.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

GDMPC: people empowering people.

loans.use: to purchase additional goats to sell.

loans.name: Junel

texts.en:
Junel, a married 23-year-old father of one, lives in the village of Camanga in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines, where he is a farmer growing palay to earn a living.

Over the past three years, he has spent much time planting, weeding and irrigating the area under the heat of the sun and on rainy days. The family's income is derived primarily from rice production, and Junel earns a total revenue of PHP 13,000 a month. He is now requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase fertilizers and pay for weeding costs.

Junel became a member of GDMPC this year, and this will be his first loan. He hopes to earn large returns from this investment in his rice production. He plans to work on additional farm fields to increase family income, and hopes for another loan from the cooperative after a full repayment of the current one.

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

GDMPC: people empowering people.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for weeding costs.

loans.name: Gemalyn

texts.en:
Gemalyn is 40 years old and married. She has 3 children ages 21, 19 and 17. Gemalyn and her husband are both farmers. They own the land that they till, located in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. Gemalyn helps her husband grow rice and vegetables. She also helps in selling their harvest at the market.

Gemalyn applied for this loan because they need seeds, herbicides and fertilizers. Gemalyn hopes to continue earning from their farm. She also hopes to sustain her children's college education.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, herbicides and fertilizers

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man with one child who is still young for school. He lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills.

For the past two years, Peter has operated a business of supplying eggs, selling them as wholesale and retail to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major high cost of transportation in his business. He dreams of expanding his business and establishing a bigger stall to sell his products.

With the 20,000 KES, he wants to purchase crates of eggs for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase crates of eggs for resale

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 50 years old and lives with her children and husband in a house in the village of Carikrikan province of Isabela. 

Elisa engaged in the business of a grocery shop. She has gained much business experience in her field. With her profits earned from the business, she pays the tuition fees of her children. She is a diligent and open-minded woman who says "I will devote my everything to my family." 

She is requesting a 23,000 PHP loan to purchase more grocery products like canned goods, spices, drinks, rice, oil and sugar from the local market to display in her store and sell in the community.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, spices, drinks and snack foods for her store

loans.name: Romelyn

texts.en:
Romelyn is 20 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 

Romelyn has a shop that sells clothing & beauty products from AVON & NATASHA. She has had this business for 1 year. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy more stock from AVON & NATASHA.

Romelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Romelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from Avon and Natasha

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is a married woman with an 11-year-old child. She and her husband are both farmers. They primarily grow rice crops to sell. Jocelyn's husband mainly manages their farm. Jocelyn, on the other hand, focuses more on raising hogs and running their sari-sari store business. Jocelyn does her best to support her family. She requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and pig feed. She hopes to have a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and pig feed

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 37 years old and already has five children. She is married and happy to say that her husband is a farmer, planting rice in the Philippines. Marina and her husband are working together to give the quality of life to their children. The couple said that there is no other happiness they will obtain in their life except in giving their children the opportunity to study and become professionals. To provide her children their daily allowances in school, Marina engages herself in selling accessories like bracelets, rings, earrings and necklaces inside the school in their village. Marina wants to borrow a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy additional products like hairpins, hair clamps and hats to sell to her customers. 

In the future, Marina wants to put up a sari-sari store (variety) business for an additional source of income for the family. She will just make it through with the income she earns from her present business and loan she wants to avail now.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell like hairpins, hair clamps and hats

loans.name: Ada

texts.en: Ada is a 47-year-old married woman with 6 children and she lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She deals in cocoa and vegetable vending, and has been in business for 7 years. Ada has hopes of turning her small enterprise into a retail shop despite challenges of limited funds to supply the vast market. Ada  intends to use the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina is a 52-year-old married woman with 6 grown children. They live in the village of Carikrikan province of Isabela. Martina is a very patient and hardworking mother. 

Martina is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy spare parts for her motorcycle in order to maintain the service that she provides to her community. Martina hopes that someday, aside from her motorcycle business, she can establish her own store to have an additional income to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is married with 3 children. She is 57 years old and lives in Romarate, Aurora Zamboanga del Sur. Felisa sells charcoal to earn a living and she has been in this business for 3 years. 

Every month, Felisa earns 7,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to purchase additional coconut shells to make charcoal for charcoal trading. (Charcoal is made from coconut shells or firewood.) Felisa sells the charcoal to her "suki" buyer and others in the community.

Felisa has been a member of GDMPC for 2 years. In the future, Felisa hopes to have another "baril" container where she burns the coconut shells for charcoal, so she can produce more charcoal. For now she has only one.


GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

GDMPC people empowering people

loans.use: purchase coconut shells to make charcoal

loans.name: Phannara

texts.en: Phannara, 29 years old, is working in the garment factory and earns $3.33 per day. Her husband is working in a factory and earns $3.50 per day. This couple has three children, all of them are studying. Every month, Phannara has to spend $55 on food, $10 on electricity, $20 on rent house fee, $30 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $350 to buy cosmetics to sell to her friends in the factory. When she has enough money, Phannara plans to rent a shop near her factory to sell cosmetics because she can make more income than working.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell to her friends in the factory

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 37 years old and lives in the village of Sto. Niño in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines.  She is married with three school-aged children.

To earn a living, Alma has a business selling a variety of vegetables in the local community such as eggplant, squash, potato, cabbage, ampalaya, green leafy vegetables, etc.  She has been running the business for over five years, and has learned many things from it - from customer care to budgeting for home and business. She earns about PHP 22,500 each month.  She has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase more vegetables to sell.

Alma joined GDMPC earlier this year and this is her second loan request made in the cooperative.  In the future she would like to improve and expand her product offerings to attract more customers, and lay aside some of the profits for her children's education. She also hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to sell.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a married man with one child who is still too young for school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past seven years, he has operated a business repairing electrical cables.  His neighbors and passers-by are his potential customers. He faces a major challenge of competition from other electricians in the area. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With his KES 20,000 loan, Patrick wants to purchase equipment and cables for his electrical business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase equipment and cables for his electrical business.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en: Clarita is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children.  She has a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks & beverages.  She has had this business for 5 years, and has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.  Clarita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Norilyn

texts.en:
Norilyn is married with 1 child. She is 28 years old and lives in La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur.  She earns a living as a public school teacher and has been in this profession for 5 years. Each month, she earns PHP 6237. She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to install electric wiring in her home.  She has been a member of GDMPC for 4 years.  In the future, she hopes to purchase a farm.

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is comprised mostly of farmers, fisher-folk and small-business entrepreneurs.

GDMPC: people empowering people.

loans.use: to install electric wiring

location.town: La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Nget

texts.en:
Nget, 57 years old, is a cake seller.  She earns $3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker and earns $3 per day. They have five children, two of whom are studying and three of whom are working.  Each of these earns $5 per day. Every month, Nget has to spend $85 on food, $80 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy a hand tractor for doing farming. She farms in the rainy season because at that time can get a good output. In the future, she wants to plant yams on the land when she has enough money.

loans.use: To buy a hand tractor for doing farming

loans.name: Lenida

texts.en:
Lenida is a 44-year-old married woman with 5 children. She and her family live in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato.

Lenida has been engaged in farming for 30 years. She primarily grows rice crops to sell at her town's market. Lenida is in need of seeds, insecticides and fertilizers. She applied for a loan to buy the farm supplies she needs. Lenida hopes to achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, insecticides and fertilizers

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en: Reynaldo is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 6 children.  He has a butcher shop where he sells meat, such as pork & beef, by the kilogram. He has had this business for 5 years, and has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy pigs to be butchered & meat to sell.  Reynaldo has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy pigs to be butchered & meat to sell

loans.name: Mukendambola Group

texts.en:
Linus is the facilitator of the Mukendambola group. Linus and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Linus and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Linus takes care of nine children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Linus had an excellent maize yield harvesting 7 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Linus was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Linus will educate his children, ensure food security and save for future use.

In 2012, the members of the Mukendambola group will each plant between 1/2 and 1 acre of maize.

 In the picture above, the Mukendambola facilitator stands on the far left with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: John Erison

texts.en:
At his young age of 19, John patiently sells kitchen wares to the people in the village where he lives with his family. He has been doing it for a year, and he earns an income to sustain his daily needs. He doesn't want to depend on his parent's sustenance, and that is why he is involved in this kind of work. 

He is now asking for a loan of P5,000 to buy kitchen wares, basins, hangers and blankets to sell and increase his earnings.

In the future, John wants to finish his education in order to have better employment someday and to help lift his family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy kitchen wares, basins, hangers and blankets to sell

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en: Raquel is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 4 children.  She has a shop where she sells fish like sardines, milkfish & mackerel.  She has had this business for 5 years, and has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy more fish to sell.  Raquel has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a single man who lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food, rent and bills.

For the past five years, he has operated a business selling spare parts to his neighbours and passers-by. He faces a major challenge of competition from other spare part vendors in the area. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. 

With his KES 80,000 loan Omar wants to purchase more spare parts to sell. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Rina

texts.en: Rina is 30 years old and earns $3 a day by working as a farmer. Her husband is a blacksmith who earns $5 per day. They have one child, who is one year old. Every month, she has to spend $40 on food, $5 on electricity and $10 on other expenses. She is applying for a loan for $500 to buy chickens, frogs and fish to cook to sell in the upcoming P’chum Ben festival. She hopes to take advantage of this opportunity to earn some extra money while also being able to care for her small child.

loans.use: to buy chickens, frogs and fish to cook and sell at a festival.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. For the last three years, she has earned a living by running a store where she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She is applying for a loan for PHP 6,000 to more items to sell to her customers. She joined HSPFI earlier this year and hopes to use her membership to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is 30 years old, married and lives with her husband and two school-aged children in the province of Isabela. She is a very devoted mother, and works hard at providing motorcycle services. She tries to ensure that her passengers are comfortable on the road and arrive on time. She is applying for a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy spare parts for her motorcycle, including new tires. She dreams of earning enough money to repair and improve her house so that her children will have a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Khut

texts.en: This borrower is from Kompong Speu Province, Cambodia. Khut is 45 years old, married and has eight children. Two of them are married and live separately, and the other children are all single.  Two of her children are employed as sewing factory workers in Phnom Penh city where they can earn enough salary for each month. Presently, Khut has been generating a business as a rice cultivator. To upgrade her family's living standard, she is asking for a loan from HKL a Kiva partner. The purpose of this loan will be to repair her broken house. She hopes that all donors will support her family. She is very thankful in advance.

loans.use: to repair her broken house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products (flour, rice, oil, fish, etc.) to increase the quantity of her merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy kitchenware (dishes, pots, flatware, and so on) for his shop.

loans.name: Annalou

texts.en: Annalou is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines with her husband and five children. For the last nine years, she has earned a living by running a store where she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She is applying for a loan for PHP 5,000 to more items to sell to her customers. She joined HSPFI earlier this year as a way to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell in her store.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en: Yolanda is a married woman. She has seven children. She describes herself as industrious, intelligent, and honest. She operates a rolling store where she sells onions, tomatoes, fruits, and cabbage. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are local households and travelers. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate space for her business operations. She will use the 9,000 PHP loan to purchase vegetables and maize to sell. Her business goal is to become involved in the sale of ready-made clothing within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to buy cabbage, tomato, eggplant and mango to sell

loans.name: Rizza

texts.en:
Rizza is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with three children. 

Rizza has a bakeshop that sells breads & pastries. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making breads & pastries.

Rizza has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rizza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making breads & pastries

loans.name: Cangrehilla Group

texts.en:
Ritchel is married with one child. She is 27 years old and lives in Luy-a, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur.

Ritchel sells vegetable to earn a living and has had this business for seven years, even before she married. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer for their farm.

Ritchel has been a member of PMPC for less than two months. In the future, Ritchel hopes to acquire her own farm area. Ritchel is the leader of a five-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business,

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Edmund

texts.en:
With his desire to improve his crop production, Edmund spends most of his time in his farming business. He plants and harvests rice and sells it to traders. He earns a yield twice a year of about PHP 20,000. Profits earned are just enough to cover their daily expenses. 

Edmund is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and molluscicides (pesticides for snails) used in farming. He wants to ensure more crop production for this next cropping season in November. 

In the future, Edmund would like to keep producing an abundant harvest and earn consistent profits to make his family economically stable.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides used in farming.

loans.name: Marinnette

texts.en:
Marinnette is 28 years old and still single. She has a store where she sells basic household goods. According to her, she has acquired many customers because she always has what people need. Aside from groceries, she also offer load (cell phone minutes) for different networks. She has been managing her store for one year as of now.

Marinnette is a hard-working woman of full goals and ideas to improve her business. One of her goals is to see her business grow, so she is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 6,000 to purchase groceries such as cooking oil, ingredients, canned goods, soft drinks and biscuits for her retail shop business. She is confident that her hard work will allow her to give her family better living conditions where she could provide all the needs of her family and save for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to purchase groceries such as cooking oil, ingredients, canned goods, soft drinks and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Madalena

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Manjacaze, Provincia  de Gaza, sul  de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 4 filhos os 3 ja são maiores de idade e ultimo ainda frenquenta a Escola. Fez 9ª classe e naõ continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta a sua mãe. 

Saiu da sua terra natal para Maputo a procura de melhores condições, é comerciante vende frangos de corte ha mais de 4 anos e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 10.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos  em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 25.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar frangos, ração e vitaminas para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
Pretende manter o seu negocio mais forte e continuar a investir na criação, assim irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Madalena was born in the district of Manjacaze, in the province of Gaza in southern Mozambique. She is married and the father of four children, three of whom are adults and the youngest of which attends school. She went to school through the ninth grade but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. She lives in her own home with her family, and also supports her mother.

She left Manjacaze for Maputo in search of a better life. She's been selling chickens for more than four years. She earns about 10,500 meticals a month, which she uses to cover household expenses. She is also able to save a small amount in her bank account (BIM). 
She has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku from friends who are also clients of the institution. This is her first loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 25,000 meticals, which she intends to use to buy chickens, feed, and vitamins to increase the quantity of her stock.
She intends to request more loans from Hluvuku to keep her business strong and continue to invest in her chickens.

loans.use: to buy chickens, feed, and vitamins.

loans.name: Caclida

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de namaacha, Provincia  de Maputo, sul  de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 4 filhos,  1 ja é maior de idade e 3 ainda frenquentam a Escola. Fez 7ª classe e naõ continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, é comerciante ha mais de 17 anos e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 11.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Já teve emprestimos  em outros bancos (TCHUMA) para construção da sua casa,o qual conseguiu pagar sem nenhumas dificuldades. Conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigas que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (amendoim,arroz,sumos,refrescos, vinhos,e outros. ) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
Pretende manter o seu negocio mais forte e construir quartos para aluguer, assim irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Caclida was born in the district of Namaacha, in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique. She is married and the mother of four children, one of whom is adult while the youngest three are still in school. She went to school through the seventh grade but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. She lives with her family in a home they own, and isn't financially responsible for anyone else.

She's never left Namaacha. She's had a shop for more than 17 years and earns 11,000 meticals a month. She uses her salary for household expenses and is able to save a small amount in her bank account (BIM).
She's had loans from other banks (TCHUMA) to build her house, which she paid off without any problems. She learned about Hluvuku from friends who are also clients of the institution. This is her first loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 20,000 meticals, which she will use to buy products (peanuts, rice, juice, soft drinks, wines, etc.) to increase the quantity of merchandise she carries.
She intends to request more loans from Hluvuku to keep her business strong and build rooms to rent out.

loans.use: to buy products (peanuts, rice, juice, soft drinks, wines, etc.) to increase her quantity of merchandise.

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Lay is 50 years old and is a food seller who earns 6.5 USD each day. Her husband hunts frogs to sell and earns 3 USD daily. The couple has seven children, three of whom are studying and four who are working and each earning 4 USD daily. Each month, Lay must spend 80 USD on food, 5 USD on electricity, 15 USD on school fees, and 10 USD on other expenses.

Lay is requesting a 1,000 USD loan to buy a motorbike so that her son can commute to work. She does not want to change her career as she makes a good profit. Lay will support her children to study in the university after they finish high school.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike so her son can travel to work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase of rice, beans, and cooking oil.
